   21: -module(process_SUITE).
   22: 
   23: %% Tests processes, trapping exit messages and the BIFs:
   24: %% 	exit/1
   25: %%	exit/2

   27: %%      suspend_process/2 (partially)
   28: %%	register/2 (partially)

  124: suite() ->
  125:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},

  137:      spawn_huge_arglist,

  149: groups() ->

  154:      {spawn_request, [],
  155:       [spawn_request_bif,
  156:        spawn_request_monitor_demonitor,
  157:        spawn_request_monitor_child_exit,

  215: 
  216: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  217:     A0 = case application:start(sasl) of
  218: 	     ok -> [sasl];
  219: 	     _ -> []
  220: 	 end,
  221:     A = case application:start(os_mon) of
  222: 	     ok -> [os_mon|A0];
  223: 	     _ -> A0
  224: 	 end,
  225:     [{started_apps, A}|Config].
  226: 
  227: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  228:     As = proplists:get_value(started_apps, Config),
  229:     lists:foreach(fun (A) -> application:stop(A) end, As),
  230:     catch erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
  231:     Config.
  232: 
  233: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  234:     Config.
  235: 
  236: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  237:     Config.
  238: 
  239: init_per_testcase(Func, Config)
  240:   when Func =:= processes_default_tab;
  241:        Func =:= processes_this_tab ->
  242:     case erlang:system_info(build_type) of
  243:         BT when BT =:= debug; BT =:= valgrind ->
  244:             {skip, "Don't run in debug/valgrind"};
  245:         _ ->
  246:             [{testcase, Func} | Config]
  247:     end;
  248: init_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
  249:     [{testcase, Func}|Config].
  250: 
  251: end_per_testcase(Func, Config) when is_atom(Func), is_list(Config) ->
  252:     %% Restore max_heap_size to default value.
  253:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size,
  254:                        #{size => 0,
  255:                          kill => true,
  256:                          include_shared_binaries => false,
  257:                          error_logger => true}),
  258:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
  259: 
  260: fun_spawn(Fun) ->
  261:     spawn_link(erlang, apply, [Fun, []]).
  262: 
  263: %% Tests that binaries as arguments to spawn/3 doesn't leak
  264: %% (unclear if this test case will actually prove anything on
  265: %% a modern computer with lots of memory).
  266: spawn_with_binaries(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  267:     L = lists:duplicate(2048, 42),
  268:     TwoMeg = lists:duplicate(1024, L),
  269:     Fun = fun() -> spawn(?MODULE, binary_owner, [list_to_binary(TwoMeg)]),
  270: 			 receive after 1 -> ok end end,
  271:     Iter = case test_server:is_valgrind() of
  272: 		     true -> 10;
  273: 		     false -> 150
  274: 		 end,
  275:     test_server:do_times(Iter, Fun),
  276:     ok.
  277: 
  278: binary_owner(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
  279:     ok.
  280: 
  281: %% Tests exit/1 with a big message.
  282: t_exit_1(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  283:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  284:     start_spawner(),
  285:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  286:     test_server:do_times(10, fun t_exit_1/0),
  287:     stop_spawner(),
  288:     ok.
  289: 
  290: t_exit_1() ->
  291:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> exit(kb_128()) end),
  292:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  293:     receive
  294: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Garbage} -> ok
  295: 	  end.
  296: 
  297: 
  298: %% Tests exit/2 with a lot of data in the exit message.
  299: t_exit_2_other(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  300:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  301:     start_spawner(),
  302:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  303:     test_server:do_times(10, fun t_exit_2_other/0),
  304:     stop_spawner(),
  305:     ok.
  306: 
  307: t_exit_2_other() ->
  308:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> receive x -> ok end end),
  309:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  310:     exit(Pid, Garbage),
  311:     receive
  312: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Garbage} -> ok
  313: 	  end.
  314: 
  315: %% Tests that exit(Pid, normal) does not kill another process.;
  316: t_exit_2_other_normal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  317:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  318:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  319:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> receive x -> ok end end),
  320:     exit(Pid, normal),
  321:     receive
  322: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Reason} ->
  323: 		  ct:fail({process_died, Reason})
  324: 	  after 1000 ->
  325: 		  ok
  326: 	  end,
  327:     case process_info(Pid) of
  328: 	      undefined ->
  329: 		  ct:fail(process_died_on_normal);
  330: 	      List when is_list(List) ->
  331: 		  ok
  332: 	  end,
  333:     exit(Pid, kill),
  334:     ok.
  335: 
  336: %% Tests that we can trap an exit message sent with exit/2 from
  337: %% the same process.
  338: self_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  339:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  340:     start_spawner(),
  341:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  342:     test_server:do_times(200, fun self_exit/0),
  343:     stop_spawner(),
  344:     ok.
  345: 
  346: self_exit() ->
  347:     Garbage = eight_kb(),
  348:     P = self(),
  349:     true = exit(P, Garbage),
  350:     receive
  351: 	      {'EXIT', P, Garbage} -> ok
  352: 	  end.
  353: 
  354: %% Tests exit(self(), normal) is equivalent to exit(normal) for a process
  355: %% that doesn't trap exits.
  356: normal_suicide_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  357:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  358:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> exit(self(), normal) end),
  359:     receive
  360: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, normal} -> ok;
  361: 	      Other -> ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  362: 	  end.
  363: 
  364: %% Tests exit(self(), Term) is equivalent to exit(Term) for a process
  365: %% that doesn't trap exits.";
  366: abnormal_suicide_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  367:     Garbage = eight_kb(),
  368:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  369:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> exit(self(), Garbage) end),
  370:     receive
  371: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, Garbage} -> ok;
  372: 	      Other -> ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  373: 	  end.
  374: 
  375: %% Tests that exit(self(), die) cannot be caught.
  376: t_exit_2_catch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  377:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  378:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> catch exit(self(), die) end),
  379:     receive
  380: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, normal} ->
  381: 		  ct:fail(catch_worked);
  382: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, die} ->
  383: 		  ok;
  384: 	      Other ->
  385: 		  ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  386: 	  end.
  387: 
  388: %% Tests trapping of an 'EXIT' message generated by a bad argument to
  389: %% the abs/1 bif.  The 'EXIT' message will intentionally be very big.
  390: trap_exit_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  391:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  392:     start_spawner(),
  393:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  394:     try
  395:         %% suppress  =ERROR REPORT=== emulator messages
  396:         ok = logger:add_primary_filter(suppress_log_spam, {
  397:             fun(#{meta := #{error_logger := #{emulator := true, tag := error}}}, _Report) ->
  398:                 stop;
  399:             (_Meta, _Report) ->
  400:                 ignore
  401:             end, ok}),
  402:         test_server:do_times(10, fun trap_exit_badarg/0),
  403:         ct:sleep(500) %% flush logging
  404:     after
  405:         ok = logger:remove_primary_filter(suppress_log_spam)
  406:     end,
  407:     stop_spawner(),
  408:     ok.
  409: 
  410: trap_exit_badarg() ->
  411:     Pid = fun_spawn(fun() -> bad_guy(kb_128()) end),
  412:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  413:     receive
  414: 	      {'EXIT',Pid,{badarg,[{erlang,abs,[Garbage],Loc1},
  415: 				   {?MODULE,bad_guy,1,Loc2}|_]}}
  416: 	      when is_list(Loc1), is_list(Loc2) ->
  417: 		  ok;
  418: 	      Other ->
  419: 		  ok = io:format("Bad EXIT message: ~P", [Other, 30]),
  420: 		  ct:fail(bad_exit_message)
  421: 	  end.
  422: 
  423: bad_guy(Arg) ->
  424:     abs(Arg).
  425: 
  426: 
  427: kb_128() ->
  428:     Eight = eight_kb(),
  429:     {big_binary(),
  430:      Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight,
  431:      big_binary(),
  432:      Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight, Eight,
  433:      big_binary()}.
  434: 
  435: eight_kb() ->
  436:     B64 = lists:seq(1, 64),
  437:     B512 = {<<1>>,B64,<<2,3>>,B64,make_unaligned_sub_binary(<<4,5,6,7,8,9>>),
  438: 		  B64,make_sub_binary([1,2,3,4,5,6]),
  439: 		  B64,make_sub_binary(lists:seq(1, ?heap_binary_size+1)),
  440: 		  B64,B64,B64,B64,big_binary()},
  441:     lists:duplicate(8, {B512,B512}).
  442: 
  443: big_binary() ->
  444:     big_binary(10, [42]).
  445: big_binary(0, Acc) ->
  446:     list_to_binary(Acc);
  447: big_binary(N, Acc) ->
  448:     big_binary(N-1, [Acc|Acc]).
  449: 
  450: %% Test receiving an EXIT message when spawning a BIF with bad arguments.
  451: trap_exit_badarg_in_bif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  452:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 10}),
  453:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  454:     test_server:do_times(10, fun trap_exit_badarg_bif/0),
  455:     ok.
  456:     
  457: trap_exit_badarg_bif() ->
  458:     Pid = spawn_link(erlang, node, [1]),
  459:     receive
  460: 	      {'EXIT', Pid, {badarg, _}} ->
  461: 		  ok;
  462: 	      Other ->
  463: 		  ct:fail({unexpected, Other})
  464: 	  end.
  465: 
  466: %% The following sequences of events have crasched Beam.
  467: %%
  468: %% 1) An exit is sent to a process which is currently not running.
  469: %%    The exit reason will (on purpose) overwrite the message queue
  470: %%    pointer.
  471: %% 2) Before the process is scheduled in, it receives a timeout (from
  472: %%    a 'receive after').
  473: %% 3) The process will crash the next time it executes 'receive'.
  474: 
  475: exit_and_timeout(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  476:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  477: 
  478:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  479:     Parent = self(),
  480:     Low = fun_spawn(fun() -> eat_low(Parent) end),
  481:     High = fun_spawn(fun() -> eat_high(Low) end),
  482:     eat_wait_for(Low, High),
  483:     ok.
  484: 
  485: 
  486: eat_wait_for(Low, High) ->
  487:     receive
  488: 	{'EXIT', Low, {you, are, dead}} ->
  489: 	    ok;
  490: 	{'EXIT', High, normal} ->
  491: 	    eat_wait_for(Low, High);
  492: 	Other ->
  493: 	    ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  494:     end.
  495: 
  496: eat_low(_Parent) ->
  497:     receive
  498:     after 2500 ->
  499: 	    ok
  500:     end,
  501:     receive
  502: 	Any ->
  503: 	    io:format("Received: ~p\n", [Any])
  504:     after 1000 ->
  505: 	    ok
  506:     end.
  507:     
  508: eat_high(Low) ->
  509:     process_flag(priority, high),
  510:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  511:     exit(Low, {you, are, dead}),
  512:     loop(erlang:monotonic_time() + erlang:convert_time_unit(5,second,native)).
  513: 
  514: %% Busy loop for 5 seconds.
  515: 
  516: loop(StopTime) ->
  517:     case StopTime >= erlang:monotonic_time() of
  518: 	true -> ok;
  519: 	false -> loop(StopTime)
  520:     end.
  521: 
  522: 
  523: %% Tries to send two different exit messages to a process.
  524: %% (The second one should be ignored.)
  525: exit_twice(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  526:     ct:timetrap({seconds, 20}),
  527: 
  528:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
  529:     Low = fun_spawn(fun etwice_low/0),
  530:     High = fun_spawn(fun() -> etwice_high(Low) end),
  531:     etwice_wait_for(Low, High),
  532:     ok.
  533: 
  534: etwice_wait_for(Low, High) ->
  535:     receive
  536: 	{'EXIT', Low, first} ->
  537: 	    ok;
  538: 	{'EXIT', Low, Other} ->
  539: 	    ct:fail({wrong_exit_reason, Other});
  540: 	{'EXIT', High, normal} ->
  541: 	    etwice_wait_for(Low, High);
  542: 	Other ->
  543: 	    ct:fail({bad_message, Other})
  544:     end.
  545: 
  546: etwice_low() ->
  547:     etwice_low().
  548: 
  549: etwice_high(Low) ->
  550:     process_flag(priority, high),
  551:     exit(Low, first),
  552:     exit(Low, second).
  553: 
  554: %% Tests the process_info/2 BIF.
  555: t_process_info(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  556:     [] = process_info(self(), registered_name),
  557:     register(my_name, self()),
  558:     {registered_name, my_name} = process_info(self(), registered_name),
  559:     {status, running} = process_info(self(), status),
  560:     {min_heap_size, 233} = process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
  561:     {min_bin_vheap_size,46422} = process_info(self(), min_bin_vheap_size),
  562:     {max_heap_size, #{ size := 0, kill := true, error_logger := true,
  563:                        include_shared_binaries := false}} =
  564:         process_info(self(), max_heap_size),
  565:     {current_function,{?MODULE,t_process_info,1}} =
  566: 	process_info(self(), current_function),
  567:     {current_function,{?MODULE,t_process_info,1}} =
  568: 	apply(erlang, process_info, [self(),current_function]),
  569: 
  570:     %% current_location and current_stacktrace
  571:     {Line1,Res1} = {?LINE,process_info(self(), current_location)},
  572:     verify_loc(Line1, Res1),
  573:     {Line2,Res2} = {?LINE,apply(erlang, process_info,
  574: 				[self(),current_location])},
  575:     verify_loc(Line2, Res2),
  576:     pi_stacktrace([{?MODULE,t_process_info,1,?LINE}]),
  577: 
  578:     verify_stacktrace_depth(),
  579: 
  580:     Gleader = group_leader(),
  581:     {group_leader, Gleader} = process_info(self(), group_leader),
  582:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_Info}} = (catch process_info('not_a_pid')),
  583:     ok.
  584: 
  585: verify_stacktrace_depth() ->
  586:     CS = current_stacktrace,
  587:     OldDepth = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, 0),
  588:     {CS,[]} = erlang:process_info(self(), CS),
  589:     _ = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, 8),
  590:     {CS,[{?MODULE,verify_stacktrace_depth,0,_},_|_]} =
  591:         erlang:process_info(self(), CS),
  592:     _ = erlang:system_flag(backtrace_depth, OldDepth).
  593: 
  594: pi_stacktrace(Expected0) ->
  595:     {Line,Res} = {?LINE,erlang:process_info(self(), current_stacktrace)},
  596:     {current_stacktrace,Stack} = Res,
  597:     Expected = [{?MODULE,pi_stacktrace,1,Line}|Expected0],
  598:     pi_stacktrace_1(Stack, Expected).
  599: 
  600: pi_stacktrace_1([{M,F,A,Loc}|Stk], [{M,F,A,Line}|Exp]) ->
  601:     case Loc of
  602: 	[] ->
  603: 	    %% No location info for some reason (+L, native code).
  604: 	    io:format("Missing location information for ~w:~w/~w",
  605: 		      [M,F,A]),
  606: 	    ok;
  607: 	[_|_] ->
  608: 	    Line = proplists:get_value(line, Loc),
  609: 	    File = proplists:get_value(file, Loc),
  610: 	    File = ?MODULE_STRING ++ ".erl"
  611:     end,
  612:     pi_stacktrace_1(Stk, Exp);
  613: pi_stacktrace_1([_|_], []) -> ok.
  614: 
  615: verify_loc(Line, {current_location,{?MODULE,t_process_info=F,1=A,Loc}}) ->
  616:     case Loc of
  617: 	[] ->
  618: 	    %% No location info for some reason (+L, native code).
  619: 	    io:format("Missing location information for ~w:~w/~w",
  620: 		      [?MODULE,F,A]),
  621: 	    ok;
  622: 	[_|_] ->
  623: 	    Line = proplists:get_value(line, Loc),
  624: 	    File = proplists:get_value(file, Loc),
  625: 	    File = ?MODULE_STRING ++ ".erl"
  626:     end.
  627: 
  628: process_info_other(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  629:     Self = self(),
  630:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> process_info_looper(Self) end),
  631:     receive after 1 -> ok end,
  632:     pio_current_location(10000, Pid, 0, 0),
  633:     pio_current_stacktrace().
  634: 
  635: pio_current_location(0, _, Pi, Looper) ->
  636:     io:format("~w call(s) to erlang:process_info/2", [Pi]),
  637:     io:format("~w call(s) to ~w:process_info_looper/1", [Looper,?MODULE]);
  638: pio_current_location(N, Pid, Pi, Looper) ->
  639:     erlang:yield(),
  640:     {current_location,Where} = process_info(Pid, current_location),
  641:     case Where of
  642: 	{erlang,process_info,2,[]} ->
  643: 	    pio_current_location(N-1, Pid, Pi+1, Looper);
  644: 	{erts_internal,await_result,1, Loc} when is_list(Loc) ->
  645: 	    pio_current_location(N-1, Pid, Pi+1, Looper);
  646: 	{?MODULE,process_info_looper,1,Loc} when is_list(Loc) ->
  647: 	    pio_current_location(N-1, Pid, Pi, Looper+1);
  648: 	_ ->
  649: 	    exit({unexpected_location, Where})
  650:     end.
  651: 
  652: pio_current_stacktrace() ->
  653:     L = [begin
  654: 	     case process_info(P, current_stacktrace) of
  655:                  {current_stacktrace, Stk} -> {P,Stk};
  656:                  undefined -> {P, []}
  657:              end
  658: 	 end || P <- processes()],
  659:     [erlang:garbage_collect(P) || {P,_} <- L],
  660:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  661:     [verify_stacktrace(Stk) || {_,Stk} <- L],
  662:     ok.
  663: 
  664: verify_stacktrace([{M,F,A,Loc}|T])
  665:   when is_atom(M),
  666:        is_atom(F),
  667:        is_integer(A),
  668:        is_list(Loc) ->
  669:     verify_stacktrace(T);
  670: verify_stacktrace([]) -> ok.
  671: 
  672: process_info_looper(Parent) ->
  673:     process_info(Parent, current_location),
  674:     process_info_looper(Parent).
  675: 
  676: %% Tests the process_info/1 BIF on another process with messages.
  677: process_info_other_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  678:     Self = self(),
  679:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> other_process(Self) end),
  680:     receive
  681: 	{go_ahead,Pid} -> ok
  682:     end,
  683: 
  684:     Own = {my,own,message},
  685: 
  686:     {messages,[Own]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  687:     
  688:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  689:     MsgA = {a,Garbage},
  690:     MsgB = {b,Garbage},
  691:     MsgC = {c,Garbage},
  692:     MsgD = {d,Garbage},
  693:     MsgE = {e,Garbage},
  694: 
  695:     Pid ! MsgA,
  696:     {messages,[Own,MsgA]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  697:     Pid ! MsgB,
  698:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  699:     Pid ! MsgC,
  700:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  701:     Pid ! MsgD,
  702:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  703:     Pid ! MsgE,
  704:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD,MsgE]=All} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  705:     {memory,BytesOther} = process_info(Pid, memory),
  706:     {memory,BytesSelf} = process_info(self(), memory),
  707: 
  708:     io:format("Memory ~p: ~p\n", [Pid,BytesOther]),
  709:     io:format("Memory ~p (self): ~p\n", [self(),BytesSelf]),
  710: 
  711:     [Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD,MsgE] = All,
  712: 
  713:     Pid ! {self(),empty},
  714:     receive
  715: 	      empty -> ok
  716: 	  end,
  717:     {messages,[]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  718: 
  719:     {min_heap_size, 233} = process_info(Pid, min_heap_size),
  720:     {min_bin_vheap_size, 46422} = process_info(Pid, min_bin_vheap_size),
  721:     {max_heap_size, #{ size := 0, kill := true, error_logger := true,
  722:                        include_shared_binaries := false}} =
  723:         process_info(Pid, max_heap_size),
  724: 
  725:     Pid ! stop,
  726:     ok.
  727: 
  728: process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  729:     %% OTP-18169
  730:     %%
  731:     %% The race window triggering this bug is quite small. This test
  732:     %% wont fail even with the bug present, but it may trigger an
  733:     %% assertion in the debug compiled emulator if the bug is
  734:     %% present...
  735:     process_flag(priority, high),
  736:     SSchdlr = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  737:                   1 -> 1;
  738:                   _ -> 2
  739:               end,
  740:     Flush = fun Flush () ->
  741:                     receive _ -> Flush()
  742:                     after 0 -> ok
  743:                     end
  744:             end,
  745:     RFun = fun RFun () ->
  746:                    receive
  747:                        {flush, From} ->
  748:                            Flush(),
  749:                            From ! flushed
  750:                    end,
  751:                    RFun()
  752:            end,
  753:     R = spawn_opt(RFun, [link,
  754:                          {scheduler, 1},
  755:                          {message_queue_data, on_heap}]),
  756:     SFun = fun SFun () ->
  757:                    receive go -> ok end,
  758:                    M = erlang:monitor(process, R),
  759:                    R ! hi,
  760:                    receive
  761:                        {demonitor, From} ->
  762:                            _ = erlang:demonitor(M),
  763:                            From ! demonitored
  764:                    end,
  765:                    SFun()
  766:            end,
  767:     S = spawn_opt(SFun, [link,
  768:                          {scheduler, SSchdlr},
  769:                          {priority, high}]),
  770:     process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(10000, S, R),
  771:     unlink(R),
  772:     exit(R, kill),
  773:     unlink(S),
  774:     exit(S, kill),
  775:     false = is_process_alive(R),
  776:     false = is_process_alive(S),
  777:     ok.
  778: 
  779: process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(0, _S, _R) ->
  780:     ok;
  781: process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(N, S, R) ->
  782:     S ! go,
  783:     erlang:yield(),
  784:     _ = process_info(R, message_queue_len),
  785:     S ! {demonitor, self()},
  786:     receive demonitored -> ok end,
  787:     R ! {flush, self()},
  788:     receive flushed -> ok end,
  789:     process_info_other_message_queue_len_signal_race_test(N-1, S, R).
  790: 
  791: process_info_other_dist_msg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  792:     %%
  793:     %% Check that process_info can handle messages that have not been
  794:     %% decoded yet.
  795:     %%
  796:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  797:     Self = self(),
  798:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() -> other_process(Self) end),
  799:     receive {go_ahead,Pid} -> ok end,
  800: 
  801:     Own = {my,own,message},
  802: 
  803:     {messages,[Own]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  804:     Garbage = kb_128(),
  805:     MsgA = {a,self(),Garbage},
  806:     MsgB = {b,self(),Garbage},
  807:     MsgC = {c,self(),Garbage},
  808:     MsgD = {d,self(),Garbage},
  809:     MsgE = {e,self(),Garbage},
  810: 
  811:     %% We don't want the other process to decode messages itself
  812:     %% therefore we suspend it.
  813:     true =  erlang:suspend_process(Pid),
  814:     spawn_link(Node, fun () ->
  815: 		Pid  ! MsgA,
  816: 		Pid  ! MsgB,
  817: 		Pid  ! MsgC,
  818: 		Self ! check_abc
  819: 	end),
  820:     receive check_abc -> ok end,
  821:     [{status,suspended},
  822: 	{messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC]},
  823: 	{status,suspended}]= process_info(Pid, [status,messages,status]),
  824:     spawn_link(Node, fun () ->
  825: 		Pid  ! MsgD,
  826: 		Pid  ! MsgE,
  827: 		Self ! check_de
  828: 	end),
  829:     receive check_de -> ok end,
  830:     {messages,[Own,MsgA,MsgB,MsgC,MsgD,MsgE]=All} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  831:     true = erlang:resume_process(Pid),
  832:     Pid ! {self(), get_all_messages},
  833:     receive
  834: 	      {all_messages, AllMsgs} ->
  835: 		  All = AllMsgs
  836: 	  end,
  837:     {messages,[]} = process_info(Pid, messages),
  838:     Pid ! stop,
  839:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
  840:     ok.
  841: 
  842: process_info_other_status(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  843:     %% OTP-17628: status was erroneously reported as 'running',
  844:     %% when it should be 'waiting', when the priority of the
  845:     %% caller exceeded the priority of the processes being
  846:     %% checked (due to prio elevation).
  847:     Self = self(),
  848:     Other = spawn_link(fun () -> other_process(Self) end),
  849:     receive {go_ahead, Other} -> ok end,
  850:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
  851:     {status, waiting} = process_info(Other, status),
  852:     process_flag(priority, high),
  853:     {status, waiting} = process_info(Other, status),
  854:     process_flag(priority, max),
  855:     {status, waiting} = process_info(Other, status),
  856:     Other ! stop,
  857:     ok.
  858: 
  859: other_process(Parent) ->
  860:     self() ! {my,own,message},
  861:     Parent ! {go_ahead,self()},
  862:     other_process_1().
  863: 
  864: other_process_1() ->
  865:     receive
  866: 	{Parent,get_all_messages} ->
  867: 	    Parent ! {all_messages, get_all_messages()},
  868: 	    other_process_1();
  869: 	{Parent,empty} ->
  870: 	    receive_all(),
  871: 	    Parent ! empty,
  872: 	    other_process_1();
  873: 	stop -> ok
  874:     end.
  875: 
  876: get_all_messages() ->
  877:     get_all_messages([]).
  878: 
  879: get_all_messages(Msgs) ->
  880:     receive
  881: 	Msg ->
  882: 	    get_all_messages([Msg|Msgs])
  883:     after 0 ->
  884: 	    lists:reverse(Msgs)
  885:     end.
  886: 
  887: receive_all() ->
  888:     receive
  889: 	_ -> receive_all()
  890:     after 0 -> ok
  891:     end.
  892: 
  893: chk_pi_order([],[]) ->
  894:     ok;
  895: chk_pi_order([{Arg, _}| Values], [Arg|Args]) ->
  896:     chk_pi_order(Values, Args).
  897: 
  898: process_info_2_list(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  899:     Proc = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
  900:     register(process_SUITE_process_info_2_list1, self()),
  901:     register(process_SUITE_process_info_2_list2, Proc),
  902:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state,true),
  903:     AllArgs = erts_debug:get_internal_state(process_info_args),
  904:     A1 = lists:sort(AllArgs) ++ [status] ++ lists:reverse(AllArgs),
  905: 
  906:     %% Verify that argument is accepted as single atom
  907:     lists:foreach(fun (A) ->
  908: 		{A, _} = process_info(Proc, A),
  909: 		{A, _} = process_info(self(), A)
  910: 	end, A1),
  911: 
  912:     %% Verify that order is preserved
  913:     ok = chk_pi_order(process_info(self(), A1), A1),
  914:     ok = chk_pi_order(process_info(Proc, A1), A1),
  915: 
  916:     %% Small arg list
  917:     A2 = [status, stack_size, trap_exit, priority],
  918:     [{status, _}, {stack_size, _}, {trap_exit, _}, {priority, _}]
  919: 	= process_info(Proc, A2),
  920:     [{status, _}, {stack_size, _}, {trap_exit, _}, {priority, _}]
  921: 	= process_info(self(), A2),
  922: 
  923:     %% Huge arg list (note values are shared)
  924:     A3 = lists:duplicate(5000,backtrace),
  925:     V3 = process_info(Proc, A3),
  926:     5000 = length(V3),
  927:     lists:foreach(fun ({backtrace, _}) -> ok end, V3),
  928:     ok.
  929:     
  930: process_info_lock_reschedule(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  931:     %% We need a process that is running and an item that requires
  932:     %% process_info to take the main process lock.
  933:     Target1 = spawn_link(fun tok_loop/0),
  934:     Name1 = process_info_lock_reschedule_running,
  935:     register(Name1, Target1),
  936:     Target2 = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
  937:     Name2 = process_info_lock_reschedule_waiting,
  938:     register(Name2, Target2),
  939:     PI = fun(_) ->
  940: 	    erlang:yield(),
  941: 	    [{registered_name, Name1}] = process_info(Target1, [registered_name]),
  942: 	    [{registered_name, Name2}] = process_info(Target2, [registered_name]),
  943: 	    erlang:yield(),
  944: 	    {registered_name, Name1} = process_info(Target1, registered_name),
  945: 	    {registered_name, Name2} = process_info(Target2, registered_name),
  946: 	    erlang:yield(),
  947: 	    [{registered_name, Name1}| _] = process_info(Target1),
  948: 	    [{registered_name, Name2}| _] = process_info(Target2)
  949:     end,
  950:     lists:foreach(PI, lists:seq(1,1000)),
  951:     %% Make sure Target1 still is willing to "tok loop"
  952:     case process_info(Target1, status) of
  953: 	{status, OkStatus} when OkStatus == runnable;
  954: 				OkStatus == running;
  955: 				OkStatus == garbage_collecting ->
  956: 	    unlink(Target1),
  957: 	    unlink(Target2),
  958: 	    exit(Target1, bang),
  959: 	    exit(Target2, bang),
  960: 	    OkStatus;
  961: 	{status, BadStatus} ->
  962: 	    ct:fail(BadStatus)
  963:     end.
  964: 
  965: pi_loop(_Name, _Pid, 0) ->
  966:     ok;
  967: pi_loop(Name, Pid, N) ->
  968:     {registered_name, Name} = process_info(Pid, registered_name),
  969:     pi_loop(Name, Pid, N-1).
  970: 
  971: process_info_lock_reschedule2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  972:     Parent = self(),
  973:     Fun = fun () ->
  974: 	    receive {go, Name, Pid} -> ok end,
  975: 	    pi_loop(Name, Pid, 10000),
  976: 	    Parent ! {done, self()},
  977: 	    receive after infinity -> ok end
  978:     end,
  979:     P1 = spawn_link(Fun),
  980:     N1 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_1,
  981:     true = register(N1, P1),
  982:     P2 = spawn_link(Fun),
  983:     N2 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_2,
  984:     true = register(N2, P2),
  985:     P3 = spawn_link(Fun),
  986:     N3 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_3,
  987:     true = register(N3, P3),
  988:     P4 = spawn_link(Fun),
  989:     N4 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_4,
  990:     true = register(N4, P4),
  991:     P5 = spawn_link(Fun),
  992:     N5 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_5,
  993:     true = register(N5, P5),
  994:     P6 = spawn_link(Fun),
  995:     N6 = process_info_lock_reschedule2_6,
  996:     true = register(N6, P6),
  997:     P1 ! {go, N2, P2},
  998:     P2 ! {go, N1, P1},
  999:     P3 ! {go, N1, P1},
 1000:     P4 ! {go, N1, P1},
 1001:     P5 ! {go, N6, P6},
 1002:     P6 ! {go, N5, P5},
 1003:     receive {done, P1} -> ok end,
 1004:     receive {done, P2} -> ok end,
 1005:     receive {done, P3} -> ok end,
 1006:     receive {done, P4} -> ok end,
 1007:     receive {done, P5} -> ok end,
 1008:     receive {done, P6} -> ok end,
 1009:     unlink(P1), exit(P1, bang),
 1010:     unlink(P2), exit(P2, bang),
 1011:     unlink(P3), exit(P3, bang),
 1012:     unlink(P4), exit(P4, bang),
 1013:     unlink(P5), exit(P5, bang),
 1014:     unlink(P6), exit(P6, bang),
 1015:     ok.
 1016: 
 1017: many_args(0,_B,_C,_D,_E,_F,_G,_H,_I,_J) ->
 1018:     ok;
 1019: many_args(A,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J) ->
 1020:     many_args(A-1,B,C,D,E,F,G,H,I,J).
 1021: 
 1022: do_pi_msg_len(PT, AT) ->
 1023:     lists:map(fun (_) -> ok end, [a,b,c,d]),
 1024:     {message_queue_len, _} = process_info(element(2,PT), element(2,AT)).
 1025:     
 1026: process_info_lock_reschedule3(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1027:     %% We need a process that is running and an item that requires
 1028:     %% process_info to take the main process lock.
 1029:     Target1 = spawn_link(fun tok_loop/0),
 1030:     Name1 = process_info_lock_reschedule_running,
 1031:     register(Name1, Target1),
 1032:     Target2 = spawn_link(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
 1033:     Name2 = process_info_lock_reschedule_waiting,
 1034:     register(Name2, Target2),
 1035:     PI = fun(N) ->
 1036: 	    case N rem 10 of
 1037: 		0 -> erlang:yield();
 1038: 		_ -> ok
 1039: 	    end,
 1040: 	    do_pi_msg_len({proc, Target1},
 1041: 		{arg, message_queue_len})
 1042:     end,
 1043:     many_args(100000,1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9),
 1044:     lists:foreach(PI, lists:seq(1,1000000)),
 1045:     %% Make sure Target1 still is willing to "tok loop"
 1046:     case process_info(Target1, status) of
 1047: 	      {status, OkStatus} when OkStatus == runnable;
 1048: 				      OkStatus == running;
 1049: 				      OkStatus == garbage_collecting ->
 1050: 		  unlink(Target1),
 1051: 		  unlink(Target2),
 1052: 		  exit(Target1, bang),
 1053: 		  exit(Target2, bang),
 1054: 		  OkStatus;
 1055: 	      {status, BadStatus} ->
 1056: 		  ct:fail(BadStatus)
 1057: 	  end.
 1058: 
 1059: otp_4725(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1060:     Tester = self(),
 1061:     Ref1 = make_ref(),
 1062:     Pid1 = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1063: 		Tester ! {Ref1, process_info(self())},
 1064: 		receive
 1065: 		    Ref1 -> bye
 1066: 		end
 1067: 	end, [link, {priority, max}, {fullsweep_after, 600}]),
 1068:     receive
 1069: 	{Ref1, ProcInfo1A} ->
 1070: 	    ProcInfo1B = process_info(Pid1),
 1071: 	    Pid1 ! Ref1,
 1072: 	    check_proc_infos(ProcInfo1A, ProcInfo1B)
 1073:     end,
 1074:     Ref2 = make_ref(),
 1075:     Pid2 = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1076: 		Tester ! {Ref2, process_info(self())},
 1077: 		receive
 1078: 		    Ref2 -> bye
 1079: 		end
 1080: 	end,
 1081: 	[]),
 1082:     receive
 1083: 	{Ref2, ProcInfo2A} ->
 1084: 	    ProcInfo2B = process_info(Pid2),
 1085: 	    Pid2 ! Ref2,
 1086: 	    check_proc_infos(ProcInfo2A, ProcInfo2B)
 1087:     end,
 1088:     ok.
 1089: 
 1090: check_proc_infos(A, B) ->
 1091:     IC = lists:keysearch(initial_call, 1, A),
 1092:     IC = lists:keysearch(initial_call, 1, B),
 1093: 
 1094:     L = lists:keysearch(links, 1, A),
 1095:     L = lists:keysearch(links, 1, B),
 1096: 
 1097:     D = lists:keysearch(dictionary, 1, A),
 1098:     D = lists:keysearch(dictionary, 1, B),
 1099: 
 1100:     TE = lists:keysearch(trap_exit, 1, A),
 1101:     TE = lists:keysearch(trap_exit, 1, B),
 1102: 
 1103:     EH = lists:keysearch(error_handler, 1, A),
 1104:     EH = lists:keysearch(error_handler, 1, B),
 1105: 
 1106:     P = lists:keysearch(priority, 1, A),
 1107:     P = lists:keysearch(priority, 1, B),
 1108: 
 1109:     GL = lists:keysearch(group_leader, 1, A),
 1110:     GL = lists:keysearch(group_leader, 1, B),
 1111: 
 1112:     GC = lists:keysearch(garbage_collection, 1, A),
 1113:     GC = lists:keysearch(garbage_collection, 1, B),
 1114:     {value, {garbage_collection, GClist}} = GC,
 1115: 
 1116:     %% This is not really documented
 1117:     true = is_integer(gv(minor_gcs, GClist)),
 1118:     true = is_integer(gv(fullsweep_after, GClist)),
 1119:     true = is_integer(gv(min_heap_size, GClist)),
 1120:     #{error_logger := Bool1,
 1121:       include_shared_binaries := Bool2,
 1122:       kill := Bool3,
 1123:       size := MaxHeapSize} = gv(max_heap_size, GClist),
 1124:     true = is_boolean(Bool1),
 1125:     true = is_boolean(Bool2),
 1126:     true = is_boolean(Bool3),
 1127:     true = is_integer(MaxHeapSize),
 1128: 
 1129:     ok.
 1130:

 1132: %% Dummies.
 1133: 
 1134: start_spawner() ->
 1135:     ok.
 1136: 
 1137: stop_spawner() ->
 1138:     ok.
 1139: 
 1140: %% Tests erlang:process_info(Pid, garbage_collection_info)
 1141: process_info_garbage_collection(_Config) ->
 1142:     Parent = self(),
 1143:     Pid = spawn_link(
 1144:             fun() ->
 1145:                     %% We set mqd to off_heap and send an tuple
 1146:                     %% to process in order to force mbuf_size
 1147:                     %% to be used
 1148:                     process_flag(message_queue_data, off_heap),
 1149:                     receive go -> ok end,
 1150:                     (fun F(0) ->
 1151:                              Parent ! deep,
 1152:                              receive {ok,_} -> ok end,
 1153:                              [];
 1154:                          F(N) ->
 1155:                              timer:sleep(1),
 1156:                              [lists:seq(1,100) | F(N-1)]
 1157:                      end)(1000),
 1158:                     Parent ! shallow,
 1159:                     receive done -> ok end
 1160:             end),
 1161:     [{garbage_collection_info, Before},{total_heap_size, THSBefore}] =
 1162:         erlang:process_info(Pid, [garbage_collection_info, total_heap_size]),
 1163:     Pid ! go, receive deep -> ok end,
 1164:     [{_, Deep},{_,THSDeep}]  =
 1165:          erlang:process_info(Pid, [garbage_collection_info, total_heap_size]),
 1166:     Pid ! {ok, make_ref()}, receive shallow -> ok end,
 1167:     [{_, After},{_, THSAfter}] =
 1168:         erlang:process_info(Pid, [garbage_collection_info, total_heap_size]),
 1169:     Pid ! done,
 1170: 
 1171:     %% Do some general checks to see if everything seems to be roughly correct
 1172:     ct:log("Before: ~p",[Before]),
 1173:     ct:log("Deep: ~p",[Deep]),
 1174:     ct:log("After: ~p",[After]),
 1175:     ct:log("Before THS: ~p",[THSBefore]),
 1176:     ct:log("Deep THS: ~p",[THSDeep]),
 1177:     ct:log("After THS: ~p",[THSAfter]),
 1178: 
 1179:     %% Check stack_size
 1180:     true = gv(stack_size, Before) < gv(stack_size, Deep),
 1181:     true = gv(stack_size, After) < gv(stack_size, Deep),
 1182: 
 1183:     %% Check used heap size
 1184:     true = gv(heap_size, Before) + gv(old_heap_size, Before)
 1185:         < gv(heap_size, Deep) + gv(old_heap_size, Deep),
 1186:     true = gv(heap_size, Before) + gv(old_heap_size, Before)
 1187:         < gv(heap_size, After) + gv(old_heap_size, After),
 1188: 
 1189:     %% Check that total_heap_size == heap_block_size + old_heap_block_size + mbuf_size
 1190:     THSBefore = gv(heap_block_size, Before)
 1191:         + gv(old_heap_block_size, Before)
 1192:         + gv(mbuf_size, Before),
 1193: 
 1194:     THSDeep = gv(heap_block_size, Deep)
 1195:         + gv(old_heap_block_size, Deep)
 1196:         + gv(mbuf_size, Deep),
 1197: 
 1198:     THSAfter = gv(heap_block_size, After)
 1199:         + gv(old_heap_block_size, After)
 1200:         + gv(mbuf_size, After),
 1201: 
 1202:     ok.
 1203: 
 1204: gv(Key,List) ->
 1205:     proplists:get_value(Key,List).
 1206: 
 1207: process_info_parent(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1208:     Child = spawn_link(fun () -> receive stop -> ok end end),
 1209:     ?assertEqual({parent, self()}, erlang:process_info(Child, parent)),
 1210:     Child ! stop,
 1211:     ?assertEqual({parent, undefined}, erlang:process_info(whereis(init), parent)),
 1212: 
 1213:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1214:     RemoteChild = spawn_link(Node,
 1215:                              fun () ->
 1216:                                      {parent, Parent} = process_info(self(), parent),
 1217:                                      garbage_collect(),
 1218:                                      {parent, Parent} = process_info(self(), parent),
 1219:                                      garbage_collect(),
 1220:                                      Parent ! remote_child_hello,
 1221:                                      receive stop -> ok end
 1222:                              end),
 1223:     ?assertEqual({parent, self()},
 1224:                  erpc:call(Node, erlang, process_info, [RemoteChild, parent])),
 1225:     receive remote_child_hello -> ok end,
 1226:     unlink(RemoteChild),
 1227:     RemoteChild ! stop,
 1228:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1229:     ok.
 1230: 
 1231: process_info_smoke_all_tester() ->
 1232:     register(process_info_smoke_all_tester, self()),
 1233:     put(ets_ref, ets:new(blupp, [])),
 1234:     put(binary, [list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, 1)),
 1235:                  list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, 2))]),
 1236:     process_info_smoke_all_tester_loop().
 1237: 
 1238: process_info_smoke_all_tester_loop() ->
 1239:     receive
 1240:         {other_process, Pid} ->
 1241:             case get(procs) of
 1242:                 undefined -> put(procs, [Pid]);
 1243:                 Procs -> put(procs, [Pid|Procs])
 1244:             end,
 1245:             erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 1246:             link(Pid),
 1247:             process_info_smoke_all_tester_loop()
 1248:     end.
 1249: 
 1250: process_info_smoke_all(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1251:     AllPIOptions = [registered_name,
 1252:                     current_function,
 1253:                     initial_call,
 1254:                     messages,
 1255:                     message_queue_len,
 1256:                     links,
 1257:                     monitors,
 1258:                     monitored_by,
 1259:                     dictionary,
 1260:                     trap_exit,
 1261:                     error_handler,
 1262:                     heap_size,
 1263:                     stack_size,
 1264:                     memory,
 1265:                     garbage_collection,
 1266:                     group_leader,
 1267:                     reductions,
 1268:                     priority,
 1269:                     trace,
 1270:                     binary,
 1271:                     sequential_trace_token,
 1272:                     catchlevel,
 1273:                     backtrace,
 1274:                     last_calls,
 1275:                     total_heap_size,
 1276:                     suspending,
 1277:                     min_heap_size,
 1278:                     min_bin_vheap_size,
 1279:                     max_heap_size,
 1280:                     current_location,
 1281:                     current_stacktrace,
 1282:                     message_queue_data,
 1283:                     garbage_collection_info,
 1284:                     magic_ref,
 1285:                     fullsweep_after,
 1286:                     {dictionary, ets_ref}],
 1287: 
 1288:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1289:     RP = spawn_link(Node, fun process_info_smoke_all_tester/0),
 1290:     LP = spawn_link(fun process_info_smoke_all_tester/0),
 1291:     RP ! {other_process, LP},
 1292:     LP ! {other_process, RP},
 1293:     LP ! {other_process, self()},
 1294:     LP ! ets:new(blapp, []),
 1295:     LP ! ets:new(blipp, []),
 1296:     LP ! list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(1000, 3)),
 1297:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1298:     _MLP = erlang:monitor(process, LP),
 1299:     true = is_process_alive(LP),
 1300:     PI = process_info(LP, AllPIOptions),
 1301:     io:format("~p~n", [PI]),
 1302:     garbage_collect(),
 1303:     unlink(RP),
 1304:     unlink(LP),
 1305:     exit(RP, kill),
 1306:     exit(LP, kill),
 1307:     false = is_process_alive(LP),
 1308:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 1309:     ok.
 1310: 
 1311: process_info_status_handled_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1312:     P = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1313:                            receive after infinity -> ok end
 1314:                    end),
 1315:     wait_until(fun () ->
 1316:                        process_info(P, status) == {status, waiting}
 1317:                end),
 1318:     %%
 1319:     %% The 'messages' option will force a process-info-request
 1320:     %% signal to be scheduled on the process. Ensure that status
 1321:     %% 'waiting' is reported even though it is actually running
 1322:     %% when handling the request. We want it to report the status
 1323:     %% it would have had if it had not been handling the
 1324:     %% process-info-request...
 1325:     %%
 1326:     [{status, waiting}, {messages, []}] = process_info(P, [status, messages]),
 1327:     unlink(P),
 1328:     exit(P, kill),
 1329:     false = erlang:is_process_alive(P),
 1330:     ok.
 1331: 
 1332: %% OTP-15709
 1333: %% Provoke a bug where process_info(reductions) returned wrong result
 1334: %% because REDS_IN (def_arg_reg[5]) is read when the process in not running.
 1335: %%
 1336: %% And a bug where process_info(reductions) on a process which was releasing its
 1337: %% main lock during execution could result in negative reduction diffs.
 1338: process_info_reductions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1339:     {S1, S2} = case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
 1340:                    1 -> {1,1};
 1341:                    _ -> {1,2}
 1342:                end,
 1343:     io:format("Run on schedulers ~p and ~p\n", [S1,S2]),
 1344:     Boss = self(),
 1345:     Doer = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1346:                              pi_reductions_tester(true, 10, fun pi_reductions_spinnloop/0, S2),
 1347:                              pi_reductions_tester(true, 10, fun pi_reductions_recvloop/0, S2),
 1348:                              pi_reductions_tester(false, 100, fun pi_reductions_main_unlocker/0, S2),
 1349:                              Boss ! {self(), done}
 1350:                      end,
 1351:                      [link, {scheduler, S1}]),
 1352: 
 1353:     {Doer, done} = receive M -> M end,
 1354:     ok.
 1355: 
 1356: pi_reductions_tester(ForceSignal, MaxCalls, Fun, S2) ->
 1357:     Pid = spawn_opt(Fun, [link, {scheduler,S2}]),
 1358:     Extra = case ForceSignal of
 1359:                 true ->
 1360:                     %% Add another item that force sending the request
 1361:                     %% as a signal, like 'current_function'.
 1362:                     [current_function];
 1363:                 false ->
 1364:                     []
 1365:             end,
 1366:     LoopFun = fun Me(Calls, Prev, Acc0) ->
 1367:                       PI = process_info(Pid, [reductions | Extra]),
 1368:                       [{reductions,Reds} | _] = PI,
 1369:                       Diff = Reds - Prev,
 1370:                       %% Verify we get sane non-negative reduction diffs
 1371:                       {Diff, true} = {Diff, (Diff >= 0)},
 1372:                       {Diff, true} = {Diff, (Diff =< 1000*1000)},
 1373:                       Acc1 = [Diff | Acc0],
 1374:                       case Calls >= MaxCalls of
 1375:                           true -> Acc1;
 1376:                           false -> Me(Calls+1, Reds, Acc1)
 1377:                       end
 1378:               end,
 1379:     DiffList = LoopFun(0, 0, []),
 1380:     unlink(Pid),
 1381:     exit(Pid,kill),
 1382:     io:format("Reduction diffs: ~p\n", [lists:reverse(DiffList)]),
 1383:     ok.
 1384: 
 1385: pi_reductions_spinnloop() ->
 1386:     %% 6 args to make use of def_arg_reg[5] which is also used as REDS_IN
 1387:     pi_reductions_spinnloop(999*1000, atom, "hej", self(), make_ref(), 3.14).
 1388: 
 1389: pi_reductions_spinnloop(N,A,B,C,D,E) when N > 0 ->
 1390:     pi_reductions_spinnloop(N-1,B,C,D,E,A);
 1391: pi_reductions_spinnloop(0,_,_,_,_,_) ->
 1392:     %% Stop to limit max number of reductions consumed
 1393:     pi_reductions_recvloop().
 1394: 
 1395: pi_reductions_recvloop() ->
 1396:     receive
 1397:         "a free lunch" -> false
 1398:     end.
 1399: 
 1400: pi_reductions_main_unlocker() ->
 1401:     Other = spawn_link(fun() -> receive die -> ok end end),
 1402:     pi_reductions_main_unlocker_loop(Other).
 1403: 
 1404: pi_reductions_main_unlocker_loop(Other) ->
 1405:     %% Assumption: register(OtherPid, Name) will unlock main lock of calling
 1406:     %% process during execution.
 1407:     register(pi_reductions_main_unlocker, Other),
 1408:     unregister(pi_reductions_main_unlocker),
 1409: 
 1410:     %% Yield in order to increase probability of process_info sometimes probing
 1411:     %% this process when it's not RUNNING.
 1412:     erlang:yield(),
 1413:     pi_reductions_main_unlocker_loop(Other).
 1414: 
 1415: process_info_self_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1416:     %% Test that signals that we have sent to ourselves are
 1417:     %% visible in process_info() result. This is not strictly
 1418:     %% a necessary property, but implemented so now. See
 1419:     %% process_info.c:process_info_bif() for more info.
 1420:     Self = self(),
 1421:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1422:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1423:                              process_info_self_signal_spammer(Self)
 1424:                      end,
 1425:                      fun () ->
 1426:                              self() ! Ref,
 1427:                              process_info(self(), messages)
 1428:                      end,
 1429:                      fun (Res) ->
 1430:                              {messages, [Ref]} = Res
 1431:                      end).
 1432: 
 1433: process_info_self_signal_spammer(To) ->
 1434:     erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, To)),
 1435:     process_info_self_signal_spammer(To).
 1436: 
 1437: process_info_self_msgq_len(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1438:     %% Spam ourselves with signals forcing us to flush own
 1439:     %% signal queue..
 1440:     Self = self(),
 1441:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1442:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self)
 1443:                      end,
 1444:                      fun () ->
 1445:                              process_info(self(), message_queue_len)
 1446:                      end,
 1447:                      fun (Res) ->
 1448:                              {message_queue_len, Len} = Res,
 1449:                              true = Len > 0,
 1450:                              ok
 1451:                      end).
 1452: 
 1453: 
 1454: process_info_self_msgq_len_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1455:     %% Spam ourselves with signals normally forcing us to flush own
 1456:     %% signal queue, but since we also want messages wont be flushed...
 1457:     Self = self(),
 1458:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1459:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self, 100000)
 1460:                      end,
 1461:                      fun () ->
 1462:                              process_info(self(),
 1463:                                           [message_queue_len,
 1464:                                            messages])
 1465:                      end,
 1466:                      fun (Res) ->
 1467:                              [{message_queue_len, Len},
 1468:                               {messages, Msgs}] = Res,
 1469:                              Len = length(Msgs),
 1470:                              ok
 1471:                      end).
 1472: 
 1473: process_info_self_msgq_len_more(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1474:     self() ! hej,
 1475:     BodyRes = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body(),
 1476:     ok = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body_result(BodyRes),
 1477:     TailRes = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail(),
 1478:     ok = process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail_result(TailRes),
 1479:     receive hej -> ok end,
 1480:     %% Check that current_function, current_location, and
 1481:     %% current_stacktrace give sane results flushing or not...
 1482:     Self = self(),
 1483:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1484:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self)
 1485:                      end,
 1486:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body/0,
 1487:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body_result/1),
 1488:     pi_sig_spam_test(fun () ->
 1489:                              process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(Self)
 1490:                      end,
 1491:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail/0,
 1492:                      fun process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail_result/1).
 1493: 
 1494: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body() ->
 1495:     Res = process_info(self(),
 1496:                        [message_queue_len,
 1497:                         current_function,
 1498:                         current_location,
 1499:                         current_stacktrace]),
 1500:     id(Res).
 1501: 
 1502: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body_result(Res) ->
 1503:     [{message_queue_len, Len},
 1504:      {current_function, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body,0}},
 1505:      {current_location, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body,0,_}},
 1506:      {current_stacktrace,
 1507:       [{process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_body,0,_} | _]}] = Res,
 1508:     true = Len > 0,
 1509:     ok.
 1510: 
 1511: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail() ->
 1512:     process_info(self(),
 1513:                  [message_queue_len,
 1514:                   current_function,
 1515:                   current_location,
 1516:                   current_stacktrace]).
 1517: 
 1518: process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail_result(Res) ->
 1519:     [{message_queue_len, Len},
 1520:      {current_function, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail,0}},
 1521:      {current_location, {process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail,0,_}},
 1522:      {current_stacktrace,
 1523:       [{process_SUITE,process_info_self_msgq_len_more_caller_tail,0,_} | _]}] = Res,
 1524:     true = Len > 0,
 1525:     ok.
 1526:     
 1527: 
 1528: process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To) ->
 1529:     process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To, 10000000).
 1530: 
 1531: process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(_To, 0) ->
 1532:     ok;
 1533: process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To, N) ->
 1534:     To ! hejhopp,
 1535:     erlang:demonitor(erlang:monitor(process, To)),
 1536:     process_info_self_msgq_len_spammer(To, N-1).
 1537: 
 1538: pi_sig_spam_test(SpamFun, PITest, PICheckRes) ->
 1539:     SO = erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, 1),
 1540:     try
 1541:         Self = self(),
 1542:         SigSpammer = spawn_link(SpamFun),
 1543:         process_flag(priority, low),
 1544:         receive after 10 -> ok end,
 1545:         Res = PITest(),
 1546:         process_flag(priority, high),
 1547:         unlink(SigSpammer),
 1548:         exit(SigSpammer, kill),
 1549:         false = is_process_alive(SigSpammer),
 1550:         PICheckRes(Res)
 1551:     after
 1552:         _ = erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online, SO)
 1553:     end.
 1554: 
 1555: process_info_msgq_len_no_very_long_delay(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1556:     Tester = self(),
 1557:     P1 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1558:                             receive after infinity -> ok end
 1559:                     end),
 1560:     {message_queue_len, 0} = process_info(self(), message_queue_len),
 1561:     {message_queue_len, 0} = process_info(P1, message_queue_len),
 1562:     P2 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 1563:                             Tester ! hello,
 1564:                             P1 ! hello,
 1565:                             receive after infinity -> ok end
 1566:                     end),
 1567:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 1568:     {message_queue_len, 1} = process_info(self(), message_queue_len),
 1569:     {message_queue_len, 1} = process_info(P1, message_queue_len),
 1570:     receive hello -> ok end,
 1571:     {message_queue_len, 0} = process_info(self(), message_queue_len),
 1572:     unlink(P1),
 1573:     exit(P1, kill),
 1574:     unlink(P2),
 1575:     exit(P2, kill),
 1576:     false = is_process_alive(P1),
 1577:     false = is_process_alive(P2),
 1578:     ok.
 1579: 
 1580: process_info_dict_lookup(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1581:     Pid = spawn_link(fun proc_dict_helper/0),
 1582:     {async_dist, AsyncDist} = process_info(Pid, async_dist),
 1583:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1584:     Bin = <<17:4096>>,
 1585:     Int0 = 9999999999999999999999999999999999,
 1586:     Int1 = 1111111111111111111111111111111111,
 1587:     Tuple = {make_ref(), erlang:monotonic_time()},
 1588: 
 1589:     %% Check that we can lookup dictionary values on another process...
 1590:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [hej, hopp]),
 1591:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [hopp, hej]),
 1592:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [Ref, Int0]),
 1593:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [Int0, Int1]),
 1594:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [Pid, Ref]),
 1595:     pdh(Pid, put_async, [Tuple, Bin]),
 1596:     undefined = pdh(Pid, put, [Bin, Ref]),
 1597: 
 1598:     erlang:garbage_collect(Pid),
 1599: 
 1600:     {{dictionary, Ref}, Int0} = process_info(Pid, {dictionary, Ref}),
 1601:     [{{dictionary, Ref}, Int0}] = process_info(Pid, [{dictionary, Ref}]),
 1602: 
 1603:     PIRes = process_info(Pid, [async_dist,
 1604:                                trap_exit,
 1605:                                {dictionary, hej},
 1606:                                {dictionary, hopp},
 1607:                                {dictionary, Ref},
 1608:                                {dictionary, Int0},
 1609:                                async_dist,
 1610:                                trap_exit,
 1611:                                {dictionary, Pid},
 1612:                                {dictionary, Tuple},
 1613:                                {dictionary, Bin}]),
 1614:     ct:log("PIRes = ~p", [PIRes]),
 1615:     PIRes = [{async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1616:              {trap_exit, false},
 1617:              {{dictionary, hej}, hopp},
 1618:              {{dictionary, hopp}, hej},
 1619:              {{dictionary, Ref}, Int0},
 1620:              {{dictionary, Int0}, Int1},
 1621:              {async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1622:              {trap_exit, false},
 1623:              {{dictionary, Pid}, Ref},
 1624:              {{dictionary, Tuple}, Bin},
 1625:              {{dictionary, Bin}, Ref}],
 1626: 
 1627:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [hej]),
 1628:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [hopp]),
 1629:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [Ref]),
 1630:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [Int0]),
 1631:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [Pid]),
 1632:     pdh(Pid, erase_async, [Tuple]),
 1633:     Ref = pdh(Pid, erase, [Bin]),
 1634: 
 1635:     erlang:garbage_collect(Pid),
 1636: 
 1637:     {{dictionary, Ref}, undefined} = process_info(Pid, {dictionary, Ref}),
 1638:     [{{dictionary, Ref}, undefined}] = process_info(Pid, [{dictionary, Ref}]),
 1639: 
 1640:     PIRes2 = process_info(Pid, [async_dist,
 1641:                                 trap_exit,
 1642:                                 {dictionary, hej},
 1643:                                 {dictionary, hopp},
 1644:                                 {dictionary, Ref},
 1645:                                 {dictionary, Int0},
 1646:                                 async_dist,
 1647:                                 trap_exit,
 1648:                                 {dictionary, Pid},
 1649:                                 {dictionary, Tuple},
 1650:                                 {dictionary, Bin}]),
 1651:     ct:log("PIRes2 = ~p", [PIRes2]),
 1652: 
 1653:     PIRes2 = [{async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1654:              {trap_exit, false},
 1655:              {{dictionary, hej}, undefined},
 1656:              {{dictionary, hopp}, undefined},
 1657:              {{dictionary, Ref}, undefined},
 1658:              {{dictionary, Int0}, undefined},
 1659:              {async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1660:              {trap_exit, false},
 1661:              {{dictionary, Pid}, undefined},
 1662:              {{dictionary, Tuple}, undefined},
 1663:              {{dictionary, Bin}, undefined}],
 1664: 
 1665:     unlink(Pid),
 1666:     exit(Pid,kill),
 1667: 
 1668:     %% Also check that it works on ourself...
 1669: 
 1670:     put(hej, hopp),
 1671:     put(hopp, hej),
 1672:     put(Ref, Int0),
 1673:     put(Int0, Int1),
 1674:     put(Pid, Ref),
 1675:     put(Tuple, Bin),
 1676:     undefined = put(Bin, Ref),
 1677: 
 1678:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1679: 
 1680:     {{dictionary, Ref}, Int0} = process_info(self(), {dictionary, Ref}),
 1681:     [{{dictionary, Ref}, Int0}] = process_info(self(), [{dictionary, Ref}]),
 1682: 
 1683:     PIRes3 = process_info(self(), [async_dist,
 1684:                                    trap_exit,
 1685:                                    {dictionary, hej},
 1686:                                    {dictionary, hopp},
 1687:                                    {dictionary, Ref},
 1688:                                    {dictionary, Int0},
 1689:                                    async_dist,
 1690:                                    trap_exit,
 1691:                                    {dictionary, Pid},
 1692:                                    {dictionary, Tuple},
 1693:                                    {dictionary, Bin}]),
 1694:     ct:log("PIRes3 = ~p", [PIRes3]),
 1695:     PIRes3 = [{async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1696:               {trap_exit, false},
 1697:               {{dictionary, hej}, hopp},
 1698:               {{dictionary, hopp}, hej},
 1699:               {{dictionary, Ref}, Int0},
 1700:               {{dictionary, Int0}, Int1},
 1701:               {async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1702:               {trap_exit, false},
 1703:               {{dictionary, Pid}, Ref},
 1704:               {{dictionary, Tuple}, Bin},
 1705:               {{dictionary, Bin}, Ref}],
 1706: 
 1707:     erase(hej),
 1708:     erase(hopp),
 1709:     erase(Ref),
 1710:     erase(Int0),
 1711:     erase(Pid),
 1712:     erase(Tuple),
 1713:     Ref = erase(Bin),
 1714: 
 1715:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1716: 
 1717:     {{dictionary, Ref}, undefined} = process_info(self(), {dictionary, Ref}),
 1718:     [{{dictionary, Ref}, undefined}] = process_info(self(), [{dictionary, Ref}]),
 1719: 
 1720:     PIRes4 = process_info(self(), [async_dist,
 1721:                                    trap_exit,
 1722:                                    {dictionary, hej},
 1723:                                    {dictionary, hopp},
 1724:                                    {dictionary, Ref},
 1725:                                    {dictionary, Int0},
 1726:                                    async_dist,
 1727:                                    trap_exit,
 1728:                                    {dictionary, Pid},
 1729:                                    {dictionary, Tuple},
 1730:                                    {dictionary, Bin}]),
 1731:     ct:log("PIRes4 = ~p", [PIRes4]),
 1732:

 1734:               {trap_exit, false},
 1735:               {{dictionary, hej}, undefined},
 1736:               {{dictionary, hopp}, undefined},
 1737:               {{dictionary, Ref}, undefined},
 1738:               {{dictionary, Int0}, undefined},
 1739:               {async_dist, AsyncDist},
 1740:               {trap_exit, false},
 1741:               {{dictionary, Pid}, undefined},
 1742:               {{dictionary, Tuple}, undefined},
 1743:               {{dictionary, Bin}, undefined}],
