 1745:     false = is_process_alive(Pid),
 1746:     ok.
 1747: 
 1748: process_info_label(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1749:     Pid = spawn_link(fun proc_dict_helper/0),
 1750:     LabelKey = '$process_label',
 1751:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1752:     Tuple = {make_ref(), erlang:monotonic_time()},
 1753: 
 1754:     undefined = pdh(Pid, put, [LabelKey, Tuple]),
 1755:     erlang:garbage_collect(Pid),
 1756: 
 1757:     {label,Tuple} = process_info(Pid, label),
 1758:     Self = self(),
 1759:     [{label,Tuple},{registered_name,[]},{links,[Self]}] =
 1760:         process_info(Pid, [label,registered_name,links]),
 1761: 
 1762:     put(LabelKey, Ref),
 1763:     {label,Ref} = process_info(self(), label),
 1764: 
 1765:     ok.
 1766: 
 1767: pdh(Pid, AsyncOp, Args) when AsyncOp == put_async;
 1768:                              AsyncOp == erase_async ->
 1769:     Pid ! {AsyncOp, Args},
 1770:     ok;
 1771: pdh(Pid, SyncOp, Args) ->
 1772:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1773:     Pid ! {SyncOp, self(), Ref, Args},
 1774:     receive {Ref, Res} -> Res end.
 1775: 
 1776: proc_dict_helper() ->
 1777:     receive
 1778:         {put, From, Ref, [Key, Value]} ->
 1779:             From ! {Ref, put(Key, Value)};
 1780:         {get, From, Ref, [Key]} ->
 1781:             From ! {Ref, get(Key)};
 1782:         {get, From, Ref, []} ->
 1783:             From ! {Ref, get()};
 1784:         {erase, From, Ref, [Key]} ->
 1785:             From ! {Ref, erase(Key)};
 1786:         {put_async, [Key, Value]} ->
 1787:             _ = put(Key, Value);
 1788:         {erase_async, [Key]} ->
 1789:             _ = erase(Key)
 1790:     end,
 1791:     proc_dict_helper().
 1792: 
 1793: suspend_process_pausing_proc_timer(_Config) ->
 1794:     BeforeSuspend = fun(_Pid) -> ok end,
 1795:     AfterResume = fun(_Pid) -> ok end,
 1796:     suspend_process_pausing_proc_timer_aux(BeforeSuspend, AfterResume),
 1797:     ok.
 1798: 
 1799: suspend_process_pausing_proc_timer_after_suspended(_Config) ->
 1800:     % We suspend the process once before using pause_proc_timer
 1801:     BeforeSuspend = fun(Pid) -> true = erlang:suspend_process(Pid) end,
 1802:     AfterResume = fun(Pid) -> true = erlang:resume_process(Pid) end,
 1803:     suspend_process_pausing_proc_timer_aux(BeforeSuspend, AfterResume),
 1804:     ok.
 1805: 
 1806: suspend_process_pausing_proc_timer_aux(BeforeSuspend, AfterResume) ->
 1807:     TcProc = self(),
 1808:     Pid = erlang:spawn_link(
 1809:         fun() ->
 1810:             TcProc ! {sync, self()},
 1811:             receive go -> ok
 1812:             after 2_000 -> exit(timer_not_paused)
 1813:             end,
 1814:             TcProc ! {sync, self()},
 1815:             receive _ -> error(unexpected)
 1816:             after 2_000 -> ok
 1817:             end,
 1818:             TcProc ! {sync, self()}
 1819:         end
 1820:     ),
 1821: 
 1822:     WaitForSync = fun () ->
 1823:         receive {sync, Pid} -> ok
 1824:         after 10_000 -> error(timeout)
 1825:         end
 1826:     end,
 1827:     EnsureWaiting = fun() ->
 1828:         wait_until(fun () -> process_info(Pid, status) == {status, waiting} end)
 1829:     end,
 1830: 
 1831:     WaitForSync(),
 1832:     EnsureWaiting(),
 1833: 
 1834:     BeforeSuspend(Pid),
 1835:     true = erlang:suspend_process(Pid, [pause_proc_timer]),
 1836:     timer:sleep(5_000),
 1837:     true = erlang:resume_process(Pid, [resume_proc_timer]),
 1838:     AfterResume(Pid),
 1839:     timer:sleep(1_000),
 1840:     Pid ! go,
 1841: 
 1842:     WaitForSync(),
 1843:     EnsureWaiting(),
 1844: 
 1845:     BeforeSuspend(Pid),
 1846:     true = erlang:suspend_process(Pid, [pause_proc_timer]),
 1847:     true = erlang:resume_process(Pid, [resume_proc_timer]),
 1848:     AfterResume(Pid),
 1849:     WaitForSync(),
 1850:     ok.
 1851: 
 1852: resume_process_resuming_proc_timer_can_resume_timer_early(_Config) ->
 1853:     TcProc = self(),
 1854:     Pid = erlang:spawn_link(
 1855:         fun() ->
 1856:             TcProc ! {sync, self()},
 1857:             receive go -> error(received_go)
 1858:             after 2_000 -> TcProc ! {sync, self()}
 1859:             end
 1860:         end
 1861:     ),
 1862: 
 1863:     WaitForSync = fun () ->
 1864:         receive {sync, Pid} -> ok
 1865:         after 10_000 -> error(timeout)
 1866:         end
 1867:     end,
 1868:     EnsureWaiting = fun() ->
 1869:         wait_until(fun () -> process_info(Pid, status) == {status, waiting} end)
 1870:     end,
 1871: 
 1872: 
 1873:     WaitForSync(),
 1874:     EnsureWaiting(),
 1875: 
 1876:     % Suspend twice, but pause the proc timer only once
 1877:     true = erlang:suspend_process(Pid),
 1878:     true = erlang:suspend_process(Pid, [pause_proc_timer]),
 1879: 
 1880:     % Pid is suspended so will not process it just yet
 1881:     Pid ! go,
 1882: 
 1883:     % At this point the process is still suspended but the timer is running again
 1884:     true = erlang:resume_process(Pid, [resume_proc_timer]),
 1885:     ?assertEqual({status, suspended}, process_info(Pid, status)),
 1886: 
 1887:     % The timer must have expired by now
 1888:     timer:sleep(5_000),
 1889: 
 1890:     true = erlang:resume_process(Pid),
 1891:     WaitForSync(),
 1892: 
 1893:     ok.
 1894: 
 1895: suspend_process_pausing_proc_timer_needs_balanced_resume_procs(_Config) ->
 1896:     Pid = erlang:spawn_link(timer, sleep, [infinity]),
 1897: 
 1898:     true = erlang:suspend_process(Pid),
 1899:     ?assertEqual({status, suspended}, process_info(Pid, status)),
 1900: 
 1901:     % No pause_proc_timer so far, so fail
 1902:     ?assertMatch({'EXIT', {badarg, _}},
 1903:                  catch erlang:resume_process(Pid, [resume_proc_timer])),
 1904:     ?assertEqual({status, suspended}, process_info(Pid, status)),
 1905: 
 1906: 
 1907:     true = erlang:suspend_process(Pid),
 1908:     true = erlang:suspend_process(Pid, [pause_proc_timer]),
 1909:     true = erlang:suspend_process(Pid, [pause_proc_timer]),
 1910: 
 1911:     % It is ok to do out-of-order resumes; here one that doesn't resume the timer
 1912:     true = erlang:resume_process(Pid),
 1913:     ?assertEqual({status, suspended}, process_info(Pid, status)),
 1914: 
 1915:     % Do more resumes, in any order
 1916:     true = erlang:resume_process(Pid, [resume_proc_timer]),
 1917:     true = erlang:resume_process(Pid),
 1918:     ?assertEqual({status, suspended}, process_info(Pid, status)),
 1919: 
 1920:     % Only one suspend remains, and it used pause_proc_timer, so fail if not resuming timer
 1921:     ?assertMatch({'EXIT', {badarg, _}},
 1922:                  catch erlang:resume_process(Pid)),
 1923:     ?assertEqual({status, suspended}, process_info(Pid, status)),
 1924: 
 1925:     % Final resume, now running
 1926:     true = erlang:resume_process(Pid, [resume_proc_timer]),
 1927:     ?assertEqual({status, running}, process_info(Pid, status)),
 1928: 
 1929:     ok.
 1930: 
 1931: suspend_process_pausing_proc_timer_stress_test(_Config) ->
 1932:     TestCaseProc = self(),
 1933:     RunTest = fun() ->
 1934:         TestRunner = self(),
 1935:         ActionDoneRef = erlang:make_ref(),
 1936:         P = erlang:spawn(fun() ->
 1937:             receive
 1938:                  _ ->
 1939:                     TestRunner ! {recv, ActionDoneRef}
 1940:             after
 1941:                 0 -> TestRunner ! {timeout, ActionDoneRef}
 1942:             end
 1943:         end),
 1944: 
 1945:         try erlang:suspend_process(P, [pause_proc_timer]) of
 1946:             true -> ok
 1947:         catch
 1948:             error:badarg ->
 1949:                 false = erlang:is_process_alive(P),
 1950:                 ok;
 1951:             error:exited ->
 1952:                 ok
 1953:         end,
 1954: 
 1955:         P ! 'wake up!',
 1956: 
 1957:         try erlang:resume_process(P, [resume_proc_timer]) of
 1958:             true -> ok
 1959:         catch
 1960:             error:badarg ->
 1961:                 false = erlang:is_process_alive(P),
 1962:                 ok
 1963:         end,
 1964: 
 1965:         receive
 1966:             {_, ActionDoneRef} -> TestCaseProc ! {ok, TestRunner}
 1967:         end
 1968:     end,
 1969: 
 1970:     NumInstances = 100_000,
 1971:     TestRunners = [erlang:spawn(RunTest) || _ <- lists:seq(1, NumInstances)],
 1972:     [
 1973:         receive {ok, P} -> ok
 1974:         after 2_000 -> error({timeout, waiting_for_runner})
 1975:         end
 1976:         || P <- TestRunners
 1977:     ],
 1978:     ok.
 1979: 
 1980: %% Tests erlang:bump_reductions/1.
 1981: bump_reductions(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1982:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 1983:     erlang:yield(),		% Clear reductions.
 1984:     {reductions,R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1985:     true = erlang:bump_reductions(100),
 1986:     {reductions,R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 1987:     case R2-R1 of
 1988: 	      Diff when Diff < 100 ->
 1989: 		  ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w", [R1, R2]),
 1990: 		  ct:fail({small_diff, Diff});
 1991: 	      Diff when Diff > 110 ->
 1992: 		  ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w", [R1, R2]),
 1993: 		  ct:fail({big_diff, Diff});
 1994: 	      Diff ->
 1995: 		  io:format("~p\n", [Diff]),
 1996: 		  ok
 1997: 	  end,
 1998: 
 1999:     %% Make sure that a bignum reduction doesn't crash the emulator (32-bit CPU).
 2000:     bump_big(R2, 16#08000000).
 2001: 
 2002: bump_big(Prev, Limit) ->
 2003:     true = erlang:bump_reductions(100000), %Limited to CONTEXT_REDUCTIONS.
 2004:     case process_info(self(), reductions) of
 2005: 	      {reductions,Big} when is_integer(Big), Big > Limit ->
 2006: 		  erlang:garbage_collect(),
 2007: 		  io:format("~p\n", [Big]);
 2008: 	      {reductions,R} when is_integer(R), R > Prev ->
 2009: 		  bump_big(R, Limit)
 2010: 	  end,
 2011:     ok.
 2012: 
 2013: %% Priority 'low' should be mixed with 'normal' using a factor of
 2014: %% about 8. (OTP-2644)
 2015: low_prio(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2016:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2017:     Prop = low_prio_test(Config),
 2018:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2019:     Str = lists:flatten(io_lib:format("Low/high proportion is ~.3f",
 2020:                                       [Prop])),
 2021:     {comment,Str}.
 2022: 
 2023: low_prio_test(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2024:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 2025: 
 2026:     %% Spawn the server running with high priority. The server must
 2027:     %% not run at normal priority as that would skew the results for
 2028:     %% two reasons:
 2029:     %%
 2030:     %% 1. There would be one more normal-priority processes than
 2031:     %% low-priority processes.
 2032:     %%
 2033:     %% 2. The receive queue would grow faster than the server process
 2034:     %% could process it. That would in turn trigger the reduction
 2035:     %% punishment for the clients.
 2036:     S = spawn_opt(?MODULE, prio_server, [0, 0], [link,{priority,high}]),
 2037: 
 2038:     %% Spawn the clients and let them run for a while.
 2039:     PCs = spawn_prio_clients(S, erlang:system_info(schedulers_online)),
 2040:     ct:sleep({seconds,2}),
 2041:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> exit(P, kill) end, PCs),
 2042: 
 2043:     %% Stop the server and retrieve the result.
 2044:     S ! exit,
 2045:     receive
 2046:         {'EXIT', S, {A, B}} ->
 2047:             check_prio(A, B)
 2048:     end.
 2049: 
 2050: check_prio(A, B) ->
 2051:     Prop = A/B,
 2052:     ok = io:format("Low=~p, High=~p, Prop=~p\n", [A, B, Prop]),
 2053: 
 2054:     %% Prop is expected to be appr. 1/8. Allow a reasonable margin.
 2055:     true = Prop < 1/4,
 2056:     true = Prop > 1/16,
 2057:     Prop.
 2058: 
 2059: prio_server(A, B) ->
 2060:     receive
 2061: 	low ->
 2062: 	    prio_server(A+1, B);
 2063: 	normal ->
 2064: 	    prio_server(A, B+1);
 2065: 	exit ->
 2066: 	    exit({A, B})
 2067:     end.
 2068: 
 2069: spawn_prio_clients(_, 0) ->
 2070:     [];
 2071: spawn_prio_clients(S, N) ->
 2072:     [spawn_opt(?MODULE, prio_client, [S, normal], [link, {priority,normal}]),
 2073:      spawn_opt(?MODULE, prio_client, [S, low], [link, {priority,low}])
 2074:      | spawn_prio_clients(S, N-1)].
 2075: 
 2076: prio_client(S, Prio) ->
 2077:     S ! Prio,
 2078:     prio_client(S, Prio).
 2079: 
 2080: make_sub_binary(Bin) when is_binary(Bin) ->
 2081:     {_,B} = split_binary(list_to_binary([0,1,3,Bin]), 3),
 2082:     B;
 2083: make_sub_binary(List) ->
 2084:     make_sub_binary(list_to_binary(List)).
 2085: 
 2086: make_unaligned_sub_binary(Bin0) ->
 2087:     Bin1 = <<0:3,Bin0/binary,31:5>>,
 2088:     Sz = size(Bin0),
 2089:     <<0:3,Bin:Sz/binary,31:5>> = id(Bin1),
 2090:     Bin.
 2091: 
 2092: %% Tests erlang:yield/1
 2093: yield(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2094:     case catch erlang:system_info(modified_timing_level) of
 2095: 	Level when is_integer(Level) ->
 2096: 	    {skipped,
 2097: 	     "Modified timing (level " ++ integer_to_list(Level)
 2098: 	     ++ ") is enabled. Testcase gets messed up by modified "
 2099: 	     "timing."};
 2100: 	_ ->
 2101: 	    MS = erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2102: 	    yield_test(),
 2103: 	    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2104: 	    case MS of
 2105: 		blocked ->
 2106: 		    {comment,
 2107: 		     "Multi-scheduling blocked during test. This test-case "
 2108: 		     "was not written to work with multiple schedulers (the "
 2109: 		     "yield2 test-case tests almost the same thing)."};
 2110: 		_ ->
 2111: 		    ok
 2112: 	    end
 2113:     end.
 2114: 
 2115: yield_test() ->
 2116:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
 2117:     receive after 1 -> ok end,		% Clear reductions.
 2118:     SC = schedcnt(start),
 2119:     {reductions, R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 2120:     {ok, true} = call_yield(middle),
 2121:     true = call_yield(final),
 2122:     true = call_yield(),
 2123:     true = apply(erlang, yield, []),
 2124:     {reductions, R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 2125:     Schedcnt = schedcnt(stop, SC),
 2126:     case {R2-R1, Schedcnt} of
 2127: 	{Diff, 4} when Diff < 30 ->
 2128: 	    ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w, Schedcnt = ~w", 
 2129: 		[R1, R2, Schedcnt]);
 2130: 	{Diff, _} ->
 2131: 	    ok = io:format("R1 = ~w, R2 = ~w, Schedcnt = ~w", 
 2132: 		[R1, R2, Schedcnt]),
 2133: 	    ct:fail({measurement_error, Diff, Schedcnt})
 2134:     end.
 2135: 
 2136: call_yield() ->
 2137:     erlang:yield().
 2138: 
 2139: call_yield(middle) ->
 2140:     {ok, erlang:yield()};
 2141: call_yield(final) ->
 2142:     case self() of
 2143: 	Self when is_pid(Self) ->
 2144: 	    ok
 2145:     end,
 2146:     erlang:yield().
 2147: 
 2148: schedcnt(start) ->
 2149:     Ref = make_ref(),
 2150:     Fun = 
 2151: 	fun (F, Cnt) ->
 2152: 		receive
 2153: 		    {Ref, Parent} ->
 2154: 			Parent ! {Ref, Cnt}
 2155: 		after 0 ->
 2156: 			erlang:yield(),
 2157: 			F(F, Cnt+1)
 2158: 		end
 2159: 	end,
 2160:     Pid = spawn_link(fun () -> Fun(Fun, 0) end),
 2161:     {Ref, Pid}.
 2162: 
 2163: schedcnt(stop, {Ref, Pid}) when is_reference(Ref), is_pid(Pid) ->
 2164:     Pid ! {Ref, self()},
 2165:     receive
 2166: 	{Ref, Cnt} ->
 2167: 	    Cnt
 2168:     end.
 2169: 
 2170: yield2(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2171:     Me = self(),
 2172:     Go = make_ref(),
 2173:     RedDiff = make_ref(),
 2174:     Done = make_ref(),
 2175:     P = spawn(fun () ->
 2176: 		receive Go -> ok end,
 2177: 		{reductions, R1} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 2178: 		{ok, true} = call_yield(middle),
 2179: 		true = call_yield(final),
 2180: 		true = call_yield(),
 2181: 		true = apply(erlang, yield, []),
 2182: 		{reductions, R2} = process_info(self(), reductions),
 2183: 		Me ! {RedDiff, R2 - R1},
 2184: 		exit(Done)
 2185: 	end),
 2186:     erlang:yield(),
 2187: 
 2188:     1 = erlang:trace(P, true, [running, procs, {tracer, self()}]),
 2189: 
 2190:     P ! Go,
 2191: 
 2192:     %% receive Go -> ok end,
 2193:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 2194: 
 2195:     %% {ok, true} = call_yield(middle),
 2196:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 2197:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 2198: 
 2199:     %% true = call_yield(final),
 2200:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 2201:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 2202: 
 2203:     %% true = call_yield(),
 2204:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 2205:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 2206: 
 2207:     %% true = apply(erlang, yield, []),
 2208:     {trace, P, out, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 2209:     {trace, P, in, _} = next_tmsg(P),
 2210: 
 2211:     %% exit(Done)
 2212:     {trace, P, exit, Done} = next_tmsg(P),
 2213: 
 2214: 
 2215:     receive
 2216: 	      {RedDiff, Reductions} when Reductions < 30, Reductions > 0 ->
 2217: 		  io:format("Reductions = ~p~n", [Reductions]),
 2218: 		  ok;
 2219: 	      {RedDiff, Reductions} ->
 2220: 		  ct:fail({unexpected_reduction_count, Reductions})
 2221: 	  end,
 2222: 
 2223:     none = next_tmsg(P),
 2224: 
 2225:     ok.
 2226: 
 2227: next_tmsg(Pid) ->
 2228:     receive
 2229: 	TMsg when is_tuple(TMsg),
 2230: 		  element(1, TMsg) == trace,
 2231: 		  element(2, TMsg) == Pid ->
 2232: 	    TMsg
 2233:     after 100 ->
 2234: 	    none
 2235:     end.
 2236: 
 2237: dist_unlink_ack_exit_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2238:     %% Verification of nc reference counts when stopping node
 2239:     %% will find the bug if it exists...
 2240:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2241:     ParentFun =
 2242:         fun () ->
 2243:                 %% Give parent some work to do when
 2244:                 %% exiting to increase the likelyhood
 2245:                 %% of the bug triggereing...
 2246:                 T = ets:new(x,[]),
 2247:                 ets:insert(T, lists:map(fun (I) ->
 2248:                                                 {I,I}
 2249:                                         end,
 2250:                                         lists:seq(1,10000))),
 2251:                 Chld = spawn_link(Node,
 2252:                                   fun () ->
 2253:                                           receive
 2254:                                           after infinity ->
 2255:                                                   ok
 2256:                                           end
 2257:                                   end),
 2258:                 erlang:yield(),
 2259:                 unlink(Chld),
 2260:                 exit(bye)
 2261:         end,
 2262:     PMs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2263:                             spawn_monitor(ParentFun)
 2264:                     end, lists:seq(1, 10)),
 2265:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
 2266:                           receive
 2267:                               {'DOWN', M, process, P, bye} ->
 2268:                                   ok
 2269:                           end
 2270:                   end, PMs),
 2271:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 2272:     ok.
 2273: 
 2274: %% Test that bad arguments to register/2 cause an exception.
 2275: bad_register(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2276:     Name = a_long_and_unused_name,
 2277: 
 2278:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch register({bad,name}, self())),
 2279:     fail_register(undefined, self()),
 2280:     fail_register([bad,name], self()),
 2281: 
 2282:     {Dead,Mref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> true end),
 2283:     receive
 2284: 	{'DOWN',Mref,process,Dead,_} -> ok
 2285:     end,
 2286:     fail_register(Name, Dead),
 2287:     fail_register(Name, make_ref()),
 2288:     fail_register(Name, []),
 2289:     fail_register(Name, {bad,process}),
 2290:     fail_register(Name, <<>>),
 2291:     ok.
 2292: 
 2293: fail_register(Name, Process) ->
 2294:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch register(Name, Process)),
 2295:     {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch Name ! anything_goes),
 2296:     ok.
 2297: 
 2298: garbage_collect(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2299:     Prio = process_flag(priority, high),
 2300:     true = erlang:garbage_collect(),
 2301:     
 2302:     TokLoopers = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2303: 		spawn_opt(fun tok_loop/0, [{priority, low}, link])
 2304: 	end, lists:seq(1, 10)),
 2305: 
 2306:     lists:foreach(fun (Pid) ->
 2307: 		Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 2308: 		DownBefore = receive
 2309: 		    {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} ->
 2310: 			true
 2311: 		after 0 ->
 2312: 			false
 2313: 		end,
 2314: 		GC = erlang:garbage_collect(Pid),
 2315: 		DownAfter = receive
 2316: 		    {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} ->
 2317: 			true
 2318: 		after 0 ->
 2319: 			false
 2320: 		end,
 2321: 		true = erlang:demonitor(Mon),
 2322: 		case {DownBefore, DownAfter} of
 2323: 		    {true, _} -> false = GC;
 2324: 		    {false, false} -> true = GC;
 2325: 		    _ -> GC
 2326: 		end
 2327: 	end, processes()),
 2328: 
 2329:     lists:foreach(fun (Pid) ->
 2330: 		unlink(Pid),
 2331: 		exit(Pid, bang)
 2332: 	end, TokLoopers),
 2333:     process_flag(priority, Prio),
 2334:     ok.
 2335: 
 2336: %% This used to cause the nofrag emulator to dump core
 2337: process_info_messages(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2338:     process_info_messages_test(),
 2339:     ok.
 2340: 
 2341: process_info_messages_loop(0) -> ok;
 2342: process_info_messages_loop(N) -> process_info_messages_loop(N-1).
 2343: 
 2344: process_info_messages_send_my_msgs_to(Rcvr) ->
 2345:     receive
 2346: 	Msg ->
 2347: 	    Rcvr ! Msg,
 2348: 	    process_info_messages_send_my_msgs_to(Rcvr)
 2349:     after 0 ->
 2350: 	    ok
 2351:     end.
 2352: 
 2353: process_info_messages_test() ->
 2354:     Go = make_ref(),
 2355:     Done = make_ref(),
 2356:     Rcvr = self(),
 2357:     Rcvr2 = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2358: 		receive {Go, Rcvr} -> ok end,
 2359: 		garbage_collect(),
 2360: 		Rcvr ! {Done, self()}
 2361: 	end),
 2362:     Sndrs = lists:map(
 2363: 	fun (_) ->
 2364: 		spawn_link(fun () ->
 2365: 			    Rcvr ! {Go, self()},
 2366: 			    receive {Go, Rcvr} -> ok end,
 2367: 			    BigData = lists:seq(1, 1000),
 2368: 			    Rcvr ! BigData,
 2369: 			    Rcvr ! BigData,
 2370: 			    Rcvr ! BigData,
 2371: 			    Rcvr ! {Done, self()}
 2372: 		    end)
 2373: 	end, lists:seq(1, 10)),
 2374:     lists:foreach(fun (Sndr) -> receive {Go, Sndr} -> ok end end,
 2375: 			Sndrs),
 2376:     garbage_collect(),
 2377:     erlang:yield(),
 2378:     lists:foreach(fun (Sndr) -> Sndr ! {Go, self()} end, Sndrs),
 2379:     process_info_messages_loop(100000000),
 2380:     Msgs = process_info(self(), messages),
 2381:     lists:foreach(fun (Sndr) -> receive {Done, Sndr} -> ok end end,
 2382: 			Sndrs),
 2383:     garbage_collect(),
 2384:     Rcvr2 ! Msgs,
 2385:     process_info_messages_send_my_msgs_to(Rcvr2),
 2386:     Rcvr2 ! {Go, self()},
 2387:     garbage_collect(),
 2388:     receive {Done, Rcvr2} -> ok end,
 2389:     Msgs.
 2390: 
 2391: chk_badarg(Fun) ->
 2392:     try Fun(), exit(no_badarg) catch error:badarg -> ok end.
 2393: 
 2394: process_flag_badarg(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2395:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(gurka, banan) end),
 2396:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(trap_exit, gurka) end),
 2397:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(error_handler, 1) end),
 2398:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(fullsweep_after, gurka) end),
 2399:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(min_heap_size, gurka) end),
 2400:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, gurka) end),
 2401:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, -1) end),
 2402: 
 2403:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, gurka) end),
 2404:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, -1) end),
 2405:     chk_badarg(fun () ->
 2406:                        {_,Min} = process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
 2407:                        process_flag(max_heap_size, Min - 1)
 2408:                end),
 2409:     chk_badarg(fun () ->
 2410:                        {_,Min} = process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
 2411:                        process_flag(max_heap_size, #{size => Min - 1})
 2412:                end),
 2413:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{}) end),
 2414:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ kill => true }) end),
 2415:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 2416:                                                         kill => gurka }) end),
 2417:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 2418:                                                         error_logger => gurka }) end),
 2419:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 2420:                                                         include_shared_binaries => gurka}) end),
 2421:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 233,
 2422:                                                         kill => true,
 2423:                                                         error_logger => gurka }) end),
 2424:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 1 bsl 64 }) end),
 2425: 
 2426:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(priority, 4711) end),
 2427:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(save_calls, hmmm) end),
 2428:     {P,Mref} = spawn_monitor(fun () -> receive "in vain" -> no end end),
 2429:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(P, save_calls, hmmm) end),
 2430:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(gurka, save_calls, hmmm) end),
 2431:     exit(P, die),
 2432:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(P, save_calls, 0) end),
 2433:     {'DOWN', Mref, process, P, die} = receive M -> M end,
 2434:     chk_badarg(fun () -> process_flag(P, save_calls, 0) end),
 2435:     ok.
 2436: 
 2437: -include_lib("stdlib/include/ms_transform.hrl").

 2439: otp_6237(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2440:     Slctrs = lists:map(fun (_) ->
 2441: 		spawn_link(fun () ->
 2442: 			    otp_6237_select_loop()
 2443: 		    end)
 2444: 	end,
 2445: 	lists:seq(1,5)),
 2446:     lists:foreach(fun (_) -> otp_6237_test() end, lists:seq(1, 100)),
 2447:     lists:foreach(fun (S) -> unlink(S),exit(S, kill) end, Slctrs), 
 2448:     ok.
 2449: 				
 2450: otp_6237_test() ->
 2451:     Parent = self(),
 2452:     Inited = make_ref(),
 2453:     Die = make_ref(),
 2454:     Pid = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2455: 		register(otp_6237,self()),
 2456: 		otp_6237 = ets:new(otp_6237,
 2457: 		    [named_table,
 2458: 			ordered_set]),
 2459: 		ets:insert(otp_6237,
 2460: 		    [{I,I}
 2461: 			|| I <- lists:seq(1, 100)]),
 2462: 		%% Inserting a lot of bif timers
 2463: 		%% increase the possibility that
 2464: 		%% the test will fail when the
 2465: 		%% original cleanup order is used
 2466: 		lists:foreach( fun (_) ->
 2467: 			    erlang:send_after(1000000, self(), {a,b,c})
 2468: 		    end, lists:seq(1,1000)),
 2469: 		Parent ! Inited,
 2470: 		receive Die -> bye end
 2471: 	end),
 2472:     receive
 2473: 	Inited -> ok
 2474:     end,
 2475:     Pid ! Die,
 2476:     otp_6237_whereis_loop().
 2477: 
 2478: otp_6237_whereis_loop() ->
 2479:     case whereis(otp_6237) of
 2480: 	      undefined ->
 2481: 		  otp_6237 = ets:new(otp_6237,
 2482: 					   [named_table,ordered_set]),
 2483: 		  ets:delete(otp_6237),
 2484: 		  ok;
 2485: 	      _ ->
 2486: 		  otp_6237_whereis_loop()
 2487: 	  end.
 2488: 	     
 2489: otp_6237_select_loop() ->
 2490:     catch ets:select(otp_6237, ets:fun2ms(fun({K, does_not_exist}) -> K end)),
 2491:     otp_6237_select_loop().
 2492: 
 2493: 
 2494: -define(NoTestProcs, 10000).
 2495: -record(ptab_list_bif_info, {min_start_reds,
 2496: 			     tab_chunks,
 2497: 			     tab_chunks_size,
 2498: 			     tab_indices_per_red,
 2499: 			     free_term_proc_reds,
 2500: 			     term_procs_per_red,
 2501: 			     term_procs_max_reds,
 2502: 			     conses_per_red,
 2503: 			     debug_level}).
 2504: 
 2505: processes_large_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2506:     sys_mem_cond_run(2048, fun () -> processes_large_tab_test() end).
 2507: 
 2508: processes_large_tab_test() ->
 2509:     enable_internal_state(),
 2510:     MaxDbgLvl = 20,
 2511:     MinProcTabSize = 2*(1 bsl 15),
 2512:     ProcTabSize0 = 1000000,
 2513:     ProcTabSize1 = case {erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2514: 	    erlang:system_info(logical_processors)} of
 2515: 	{Schdlrs, Cpus} when is_integer(Cpus),
 2516: 	Schdlrs =< Cpus ->
 2517: 	    ProcTabSize0;
 2518: 	_ ->
 2519: 	    ProcTabSize0 div 4
 2520:     end,
 2521:     BT = erlang:system_info(build_type),
 2522:     ProcTabSize2 = case (BT =:= debug) or (BT =:= valgrind) of
 2523: 	true -> ProcTabSize1 - 500000;
 2524: 	false -> ProcTabSize1
 2525:     end,
 2526:     %% With high debug levels this test takes so long time that
 2527:     %% the connection times out; therefore, shrink the test on
 2528:     %% high debug levels.
 2529:     DbgLvl = case erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info) of
 2530: 		       #ptab_list_bif_info{debug_level = Lvl} when Lvl > MaxDbgLvl ->
 2531: 			   20;
 2532: 		       #ptab_list_bif_info{debug_level = Lvl} when Lvl < 0 ->
 2533: 			   ct:fail({debug_level, Lvl});
 2534: 		       #ptab_list_bif_info{debug_level = Lvl} ->
 2535: 			   Lvl
 2536: 		   end,
 2537:     ProcTabSize3 = ProcTabSize2 - (1300000 * DbgLvl div MaxDbgLvl),
 2538:     ProcTabSize = case ProcTabSize3 < MinProcTabSize of
 2539: 			    true -> MinProcTabSize;
 2540: 			    false -> ProcTabSize3
 2541: 			end,
 2542:     {ok, Peer, LargeNode} = ?CT_PEER(["+P", integer_to_list(ProcTabSize)]),
 2543:     Res = rpc:call(LargeNode, ?MODULE, processes_bif_test, []),
 2544:     case rpc:call(LargeNode,
 2545: 			erts_debug,
 2546: 			get_internal_state,
 2547: 			[processes_bif_info]) of
 2548: 	      #ptab_list_bif_info{tab_chunks = Chunks} when is_integer(Chunks),
 2549: 							    Chunks > 1 -> ok;
 2550: 	      PBInfo -> ct:fail(PBInfo)
 2551: 	  end,
 2552:     stop_node(Peer, LargeNode),
 2553:     chk_processes_bif_test_res(Res).
 2554: 
 2555: processes_default_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2556:     sys_mem_cond_run(1024, fun () -> processes_default_tab_test() end).
 2557: 
 2558: processes_default_tab_test() ->
 2559:     {ok, Peer, DefaultNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2560:     Res = rpc:call(DefaultNode, ?MODULE, processes_bif_test, []),
 2561:     stop_node(Peer, DefaultNode),
 2562:     chk_processes_bif_test_res(Res).
 2563: 
 2564: processes_small_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2565:     {ok, Peer, SmallNode} = ?CT_PEER(["+P","1024"]),
 2566:     Res    = rpc:call(SmallNode, ?MODULE, processes_bif_test, []),
 2567:     PBInfo = rpc:call(SmallNode, erts_debug, get_internal_state, [processes_bif_info]),
 2568:     stop_node(Peer, SmallNode),
 2569:     true = PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.tab_chunks < 10,
 2570:     chk_processes_bif_test_res(Res).
 2571: 
 2572: processes_this_tab(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2573:     Mem = case {erlang:system_info(build_type),
 2574:                 erlang:system_info(allocator)} of
 2575:               {lcnt, {_, _Vsn, [sys_alloc], _Opts}} ->
 2576:                   %% When running +Mea min + lcnt we may need more memory
 2577:                   1024 * 4;
 2578:               _ ->
 2579:                   1024
 2580:           end,
 2581:     sys_mem_cond_run(Mem, fun () -> chk_processes_bif_test_res(processes_bif_test()) end).
 2582: 
 2583: chk_processes_bif_test_res(ok) -> ok;
 2584: chk_processes_bif_test_res({comment, _} = Comment) -> Comment;
 2585: chk_processes_bif_test_res(Failure) -> ct:fail(Failure).
 2586: 
 2587: print_processes_bif_info(#ptab_list_bif_info{min_start_reds = MinStartReds,
 2588: 					     tab_chunks = TabChunks,
 2589: 					     tab_chunks_size = TabChunksSize,
 2590: 					     tab_indices_per_red = TabIndPerRed,
 2591: 					     free_term_proc_reds = FreeTPReds,
 2592: 					     term_procs_per_red = TPPerRed,
 2593: 					     term_procs_max_reds = TPMaxReds,
 2594: 					     conses_per_red = ConsesPerRed,
 2595: 					     debug_level = DbgLvl}) ->
 2596:     io:format("processes/0 bif info on node ~p:~n"
 2597: 	      "Min start reductions = ~p~n"
 2598: 	      "Process table chunks = ~p~n"
 2599: 	      "Process table chunks size = ~p~n"
 2600: 	      "Process table indices per reduction = ~p~n"
 2601: 	      "Reduction cost for free() on terminated process struct = ~p~n"
 2602: 	      "Inspect terminated processes per reduction = ~p~n"
 2603: 	      "Max reductions during inspection of terminated processes = ~p~n"
 2604: 	      "Create cons-cells per reduction = ~p~n"
 2605: 	      "Debug level = ~p~n",
 2606: 	      [node(),
 2607: 	       MinStartReds,
 2608: 	       TabChunks,
 2609: 	       TabChunksSize,
 2610: 	       TabIndPerRed,
 2611: 	       FreeTPReds,
 2612: 	       TPPerRed,
 2613: 	       TPMaxReds,
 2614: 	       ConsesPerRed,
 2615: 	       DbgLvl]).

 2617: processes_bif_cleaner() ->
 2618:     receive {'EXIT', _, _} -> ok end,
 2619:     processes_bif_cleaner().

 2621: spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner) ->
 2622:     TabSz = erlang:system_info(process_limit),
 2623:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(next_pid,TabSz),
 2624:     spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner,
 2625: 			      TabSz,
 2626: 			      TabSz*2,
 2627: 			      0,
 2628: 			      []).
 2629: 
 2630: processes_unexpected_result(CorrectProcs, Procs) ->
 2631:     ProcInfo = [registered_name,
 2632: 		initial_call,
 2633: 		current_function,
 2634: 		status,
 2635: 		priority],
 2636:     MissingProcs = CorrectProcs -- Procs,
 2637:     io:format("Missing processes: ~p",
 2638: 	      [lists:map(fun (Pid) ->
 2639: 				 [{pid, Pid}
 2640: 				  | case process_info(Pid, ProcInfo) of
 2641: 					undefined -> [];
 2642: 					Res -> Res
 2643: 				    end]
 2644: 			 end,
 2645: 			 MissingProcs)]),
 2646:     SuperfluousProcs = Procs -- CorrectProcs,
 2647:     io:format("Superfluous processes: ~p",
 2648: 	      [lists:map(fun (Pid) ->
 2649: 				 [{pid, Pid}
 2650: 				  | case process_info(Pid, ProcInfo) of
 2651: 					undefined -> [];
 2652: 					Res -> Res
 2653: 				    end]
 2654: 			 end,
 2655: 			 SuperfluousProcs)]),
 2656:     ct:fail(unexpected_result).
 2657: 
 2658: hangaround(Cleaner, Type) ->
 2659:     %% Type is only used to distinguish different processes from
 2660:     %% when doing process_info
 2661:     try link(Cleaner) catch error:Reason -> exit(Reason) end,
 2662:     receive after infinity -> ok end,
 2663:     exit(Type).
 2664: 
 2665: spawn_initial_hangarounds(_Cleaner, NP, Max, Len, HAs) when NP > Max ->
 2666:     {Len, HAs};
 2667: spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner, NP, Max, Len, HAs) ->
 2668:     Skip = 30,
 2669:     wait_for_proc_slots(Skip+3),
 2670:     HA1 = spawn_opt(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, initial_hangaround],
 2671: 		    [{priority, low}]),
 2672:     HA2 = spawn_opt(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, initial_hangaround],
 2673: 		    [{priority, normal}]),
 2674:     HA3 = spawn_opt(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, initial_hangaround],
 2675: 		    [{priority, high}]),
 2676:     spawn_drop(Skip),
 2677:     spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner, NP+Skip, Max, Len+3, [HA1,HA2,HA3|HAs]).
 2678: 
 2679: wait_for_proc_slots(MinFreeSlots) ->
 2680:     case erlang:system_info(process_limit) - erlang:system_info(process_count) of
 2681:         FreeSlots when FreeSlots < MinFreeSlots ->
 2682:             receive after 10 -> ok end,
 2683:             wait_for_proc_slots(MinFreeSlots);
 2684:         _FreeSlots ->
 2685:             ok
 2686:     end.
 2687: 
 2688: spawn_drop(N) when N =< 0 ->
 2689:     ok;
 2690: spawn_drop(N) ->
 2691:     spawn(fun () -> ok end),
 2692:     spawn_drop(N-1).
 2693: 
 2694: do_processes(WantReds) ->
 2695:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, WantReds),
 2696:     processes().
 2697: 
 2698: processes_bif_test() ->
 2699:     Tester = self(),
 2700:     enable_internal_state(),
 2701:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2702:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2703:     WantReds = PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds + 10,
 2704:     WillTrap = case PBInfo of
 2705: 	#ptab_list_bif_info{tab_chunks = Chunks} when Chunks < 10 ->
 2706: 	    false; %% Skip for small tables
 2707: 	#ptab_list_bif_info{tab_chunks = Chunks,
 2708: 	    tab_chunks_size = ChunksSize,
 2709: 	    tab_indices_per_red = IndiciesPerRed
 2710: 	} ->
 2711: 	    Chunks*ChunksSize >= IndiciesPerRed*WantReds
 2712:     end,
 2713:     Processes = fun () ->
 2714: 	    erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,WantReds),
 2715: 	    processes()
 2716:     end,
 2717: 
 2718:     IterProcesses =
 2719:         fun () ->
 2720:                 erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, WantReds),
 2721:                 iter_all_processes()
 2722:         end,
 2723: 
 2724:     ok = do_processes_bif_test(WantReds, WillTrap, Processes),
 2725:     ok = do_processes_bif_test(WantReds, false, IterProcesses()),
 2726: 
 2727:     case WillTrap of
 2728: 	false ->
 2729: 	    ok;
 2730: 	true ->
 2731: 	    %% Do it against with a process suspended while
 2732: 	    %% in the processes/0 bif.
 2733: 	    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2734: 	    Suspendee = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2735: 						 Tester ! {suspend_me, self()},
 2736: 						 Tester ! {self(),
 2737: 							   done,
 2738: 							   hd(Processes())},
 2739: 						 receive
 2740: 						 after infinity ->
 2741: 							 ok
 2742: 						 end
 2743: 					 end),
 2744: 	    receive {suspend_me, Suspendee} -> ok end,
 2745: 	    erlang:suspend_process(Suspendee),
 2746: 	    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2747: 	    
 2748: 	    [{status,suspended},{current_function,{erlang,ptab_list_continue,2}}] =
 2749: 		process_info(Suspendee, [status, current_function]),
 2750: 
 2751: 	    ok = do_processes_bif_test(WantReds, WillTrap, Processes),
 2752: 	    
 2753: 	    erlang:resume_process(Suspendee),
 2754: 	    receive {Suspendee, done, _} -> ok end,
 2755: 	    unlink(Suspendee),
 2756: 	    exit(Suspendee, bang)
 2757:     end,
 2758:     case get(processes_bif_testcase_comment) of
 2759: 	undefined -> ok;
 2760: 	Comment -> {comment, Comment}
 2761:     end.
 2762: 
 2763: iter_all_processes() ->
 2764:     Iter = erlang:processes_iterator(),
 2765:     iter_all_processes(Iter).
 2766: 
 2767: iter_all_processes(Iter0) ->
 2768:     case erlang:processes_next(Iter0) of
 2769:         {Pid, Iter} ->
 2770:             [Pid|iter_all_processes(Iter)];
 2771:         none ->
 2772:             none
 2773:     end.
 2774: 
 2775: do_processes_bif_test(WantReds, DieTest, Processes) ->
 2776:     Tester = self(),
 2777:     SpawnProcesses = fun (Prio) ->
 2778: 	    spawn_opt(?MODULE, do_processes, [WantReds], [link, {priority, Prio}])
 2779:     end,
 2780:     Cleaner = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2781: 		process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 2782: 		Tester ! {cleaner_alive, self()},
 2783: 		processes_bif_cleaner()
 2784: 	end),
 2785:     receive {cleaner_alive, Cleaner} -> ok end,
 2786:     try
 2787: 	DoIt = make_ref(),
 2788: 	GetGoing = make_ref(),
 2789: 	{NoTestProcs, TestProcs} = spawn_initial_hangarounds(Cleaner),
 2790: 	io:format("Testing with ~p processes~n", [NoTestProcs]),
 2791: 	SpawnHangAround = fun () ->
 2792: 		spawn(?MODULE, hangaround, [Cleaner, new_hangaround])
 2793: 	end,
 2794: 	Killer = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 2795: 		    Splt = NoTestProcs div 10,
 2796: 		    {TP1, TP23} = lists:split(Splt, TestProcs),
 2797: 		    {TP2, TP3} = lists:split(Splt, TP23),
 2798: 		    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 2799: 		    Tester ! DoIt,
 2800: 		    receive GetGoing -> ok end,
 2801: 		    erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 2802: 		    SpawnProcesses(high),
 2803: 		    lists:foreach( fun (P) ->
 2804: 				SpawnHangAround(),
 2805: 				exit(P, bang)
 2806: 			end, TP1),
 2807: 		    SpawnProcesses(high),
 2808: 		    erlang:yield(),
 2809: 		    lists:foreach( fun (P) ->
 2810: 				SpawnHangAround(),
 2811: 				exit(P, bang)
 2812: 			end, TP2),
 2813: 		    SpawnProcesses(high),
 2814: 		    lists:foreach(
 2815: 			fun (P) ->
 2816: 				SpawnHangAround(),
 2817: 				exit(P, bang)
 2818: 			end, TP3)
 2819: 	    end, [{priority, high}, link]),
 2820: 	receive DoIt -> ok end,
 2821: 	process_flag(priority, low),
 2822: 	SpawnProcesses(low),
 2823: 	erlang:yield(),
 2824: 	process_flag(priority, normal),
 2825: 	CorrectProcs0 = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes),
 2826: 	Killer ! GetGoing,
 2827: 	erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, WantReds),
 2828: 	Procs0 = processes(),
 2829: 	Procs = lists:sort(Procs0),
 2830: 	CorrectProcs = lists:sort(CorrectProcs0),
 2831: 	LengthCorrectProcs = length(CorrectProcs),
 2832: 	io:format("~p = length(CorrectProcs)~n", [LengthCorrectProcs]),
 2833: 	true = LengthCorrectProcs > NoTestProcs,
 2834: 	case CorrectProcs =:= Procs of
 2835: 	    true ->
 2836: 		ok;
 2837: 	    false ->
 2838: 		processes_unexpected_result(CorrectProcs, Procs)
 2839: 	end,
 2840: 	unlink(Killer),
 2841: 	exit(Killer, bang)
 2842:     after
 2843: 	unlink(Cleaner),
 2844:         exit(Cleaner, kill),
 2845:         %% Wait for the system to recover to a normal state...
 2846: 	wait_until_system_recover()
 2847:     end,
 2848:     do_processes_bif_die_test(DieTest, Processes),
 2849:     ok.
 2850: 
 2851: 
 2852: do_processes_bif_die_test(false, _Processes) ->
 2853:     io:format("Skipping test killing process executing processes/0~n",[]),
 2854:     ok;
 2855: do_processes_bif_die_test(true, Processes) ->
 2856:     do_processes_bif_die_test(5, Processes);
 2857: do_processes_bif_die_test(N, Processes) ->
 2858:     io:format("Doing test killing process executing processes/0~n",[]),
 2859:     try
 2860: 	Tester = self(),
 2861: 	Oooh_Nooooooo = make_ref(),
 2862: 	{_, DieWhileDoingMon} = erlang:spawn_monitor( fun () ->
 2863: 		    Victim = self(),
 2864: 		    spawn_opt(
 2865: 			fun () ->
 2866: 				exit(Victim, got_him)
 2867: 			end,
 2868: 			[link, {priority, max}]),
 2869: 		    Tester ! {Oooh_Nooooooo,
 2870: 			hd(Processes())},
 2871: 		    exit(ohhhh_nooooo)
 2872: 	    end),
 2873: 	receive
 2874: 	    {'DOWN', DieWhileDoingMon, _, _, Reason} ->
 2875: 		case Reason of
 2876: 		    got_him -> ok;
 2877: 		    _ -> throw({kill_in_trap, Reason})
 2878: 		end
 2879: 	end,
 2880: 	receive
 2881: 	    {Oooh_Nooooooo, _} ->
 2882: 		throw({kill_in_trap, 'Oooh_Nooooooo'})
 2883: 	after 0 ->
 2884: 		ok
 2885: 	end,
 2886: 	PrcsCllrsSeqLen = 2*erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 2887: 	PrcsCllrsSeq = lists:seq(1, PrcsCllrsSeqLen),
 2888: 	ProcsCallers = lists:map( fun (_) ->
 2889: 		    spawn_link(
 2890: 			fun () ->
 2891: 				Tester ! hd(Processes())
 2892: 			end)
 2893: 	    end, PrcsCllrsSeq),
 2894: 	erlang:yield(),
 2895: 	{ProcsCallers1, ProcsCallers2} = lists:split(PrcsCllrsSeqLen div 2,
 2896: 						     ProcsCallers),
 2897: 	process_flag(priority, high),
 2898: 	lists:foreach(
 2899: 		fun (P) ->
 2900: 			unlink(P),
 2901: 			exit(P, bang)
 2902: 		end,
 2903: 		lists:reverse(ProcsCallers2) ++ ProcsCallers1),
 2904: 	process_flag(priority, normal),
 2905: 	ok
 2906:     catch
 2907: 	throw:{kill_in_trap, R} when N > 0 ->
 2908: 	    io:format("Failed to kill in trap: ~p~n", [R]),
 2909: 	    io:format("Trying again~n", []),
 2910: 	    do_processes_bif_die_test(N-1, Processes)
 2911:     end.
 2912: 	    
 2913: 
 2914: wait_until_system_recover() ->
 2915:     %% If system hasn't recovered after 10 seconds we give up
 2916:     Tmr = erlang:start_timer(10000, self(), no_more_wait),
 2917:     wait_until_system_recover(Tmr).
 2918: 
 2919: wait_until_system_recover(Tmr) ->
 2920:     try
 2921: 	lists:foreach(fun (P) when P == self() ->
 2922: 			      ok;
 2923: 			  (P) ->
 2924: 			      case process_info(P, initial_call) of
 2925: 				  {initial_call,{?MODULE, _, _}} ->
 2926: 				      throw(wait);
 2927: 				  {initial_call,{_, _, _}} ->
 2928: 				      ok;
 2929: 				  undefined ->
 2930: 				      ok
 2931: 			      end
 2932: 		      end,
 2933: 		      processes())
 2934:     catch
 2935: 	throw:wait ->
 2936: 	    receive
 2937: 		{timeout, Tmr, _} ->
 2938: 		    Comment = "WARNING: Test processes still hanging around!",
 2939: 		    io:format("~s~n", [Comment]),
 2940: 		    put(processes_bif_testcase_comment, Comment),
 2941: 		    lists:foreach(
 2942: 		      fun (P) when P == self() ->
 2943: 			      ok;
 2944: 			  (P) ->
 2945: 			      case process_info(P, initial_call) of
 2946: 				  {initial_call,{?MODULE, _, _} = MFA} ->
 2947: 				      io:format("~p ~p~n", [P, MFA]);
 2948: 				  {initial_call,{_, _, _}} ->
 2949: 				      ok;
 2950: 				  undefined ->
 2951: 				      ok
 2952: 			      end
 2953: 		      end,
 2954: 		      processes())
 2955: 	    after 100 ->
 2956: 		    wait_until_system_recover(Tmr)
 2957: 	    end
 2958:     end,
 2959:     erlang:cancel_timer(Tmr),
 2960:     receive {timeout, Tmr, _} -> ok after 0 -> ok end,
 2961:     ok.
 2962: 
 2963: processes_last_call_trap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2964:     enable_internal_state(),
 2965:     Processes = fun () -> processes() end,
 2966:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2967:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2968:     WantReds = case PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds of
 2969: 	R when R > 10 -> R - 1;
 2970: 	_R -> 9
 2971:     end,
 2972:     lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 2973: 		erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,
 2974: 		    WantReds),
 2975: 		Processes(),
 2976: 		erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,
 2977: 		    WantReds),
 2978: 		my_processes()
 2979: 	end,
 2980: 	lists:seq(1,100)).
 2981:     
 2982: my_processes() ->
 2983:     processes().
 2984: 
 2985: processes_apply_trap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2986:     enable_internal_state(),
 2987:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 2988:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 2989:     WantReds = case PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds of
 2990: 	R when R > 10 -> R - 1;
 2991: 	_R -> 9
 2992:     end,
 2993:     lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 2994: 		erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,
 2995: 		    WantReds),
 2996: 		apply(erlang, processes, [])
 2997: 	end, lists:seq(1,100)).
 2998: 
 2999: processes_gc_trap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3000:     Tester = self(),
 3001:     enable_internal_state(),
 3002:     PBInfo = erts_debug:get_internal_state(processes_bif_info),
 3003:     print_processes_bif_info(PBInfo),
 3004:     WantReds = PBInfo#ptab_list_bif_info.min_start_reds + 10,
 3005:     Processes = fun () ->
 3006: 	    erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left,WantReds),
 3007: 	    processes()
 3008:     end,
 3009: 
 3010:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, block_normal),
 3011:     Suspendee = spawn_link(fun () ->
 3012: 					 Tester ! {suspend_me, self()},
 3013: 					 Tester ! {self(),
 3014: 						   done,
 3015: 						   hd(Processes())},
 3016: 					 receive after infinity -> ok end
 3017: 				 end),
 3018:     receive {suspend_me, Suspendee} -> ok end,
 3019:     erlang:suspend_process(Suspendee),
 3020:     erlang:system_flag(multi_scheduling, unblock_normal),
 3021: 	    
 3022:     [{status,suspended}, {current_function,{erlang,ptab_list_continue,2}}]
 3023: 	= process_info(Suspendee, [status, current_function]),
 3024: 
 3025:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 3026:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 3027: 	    
 3028:     erlang:resume_process(Suspendee),
 3029:     receive {Suspendee, done, _} -> ok end,
 3030:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 3031:     erlang:garbage_collect(Suspendee),
 3032: 
 3033:     unlink(Suspendee),
 3034:     exit(Suspendee, bang),
 3035:     ok.
 3036: 
 3037: process_flag_fullsweep_after(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3038:     {fullsweep_after, OldFSA} = process_info(self(), fullsweep_after),
 3039:     OldFSA = process_flag(fullsweep_after, 12345),
 3040:     {fullsweep_after, 12345} = process_info(self(), fullsweep_after),
 3041:     12345 = process_flag(fullsweep_after, 0),
 3042:     {fullsweep_after, 0} = process_info(self(), fullsweep_after),
 3043:     0 = process_flag(fullsweep_after, OldFSA),
 3044:     ok.
 3045: 
 3046: process_flag_heap_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3047:     HSize  = 2586,   % must be gc fib+ number
 3048:     VHSize = 318187, % must be gc fib+ number
 3049:     OldHmin = erlang:process_flag(min_heap_size, HSize),
 3050:     {min_heap_size, HSize} = erlang:process_info(self(), min_heap_size),
 3051:     OldVHmin = erlang:process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize),
 3052:     {min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize} = erlang:process_info(self(), min_bin_vheap_size),
 3053:     HSize = erlang:process_flag(min_heap_size, OldHmin),
 3054:     VHSize = erlang:process_flag(min_bin_vheap_size, OldVHmin),
 3055:     ok.
 3056: 
 3057: %% test that max_heap_size is correctly handled when passed via command line
 3058: command_line_max_heap_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3059:     %% test maximum heap size
 3060:     HMax = case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
 3061:                8 -> (1 bsl 59) - 1;
 3062:                4 -> (1 bsl 27) - 1
 3063:            end,
 3064:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+hmax", integer_to_list(HMax)]),
 3065:     Pid = erlang:spawn(Node, fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
 3066:     {max_heap_size, #{size := HMax}} = rpc:call(Node, erlang, process_info, [Pid, max_heap_size]),
 3067:     peer:stop(Peer).
 3068: 
 3069: spawn_opt_heap_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3070:     HSize  = 987,   % must be gc fib+ number
 3071:     VHSize = 46422, % must be gc fib+ number
 3072:     Pid  = spawn_opt(fun () -> receive stop -> ok end end,
 3073: 	[{min_heap_size, HSize},{ min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize}]),
 3074:     {min_heap_size, HSize} = process_info(Pid, min_heap_size),
 3075:     {min_bin_vheap_size, VHSize} = process_info(Pid, min_bin_vheap_size),
 3076:     Pid ! stop,
 3077:     ok.
 3078: 
 3079: spawn_opt_max_heap_size(_Config) ->
 3080: 
 3081:     error_logger:add_report_handler(?MODULE, self()),
 3082: 
 3083:     %% flush any prior messages in error_logger
 3084:     Pid = spawn(fun() -> ok = nok end),
 3085:     receive
 3086:         {error, _, {emulator, _, [Pid|_]}} ->
 3087:             flush()
 3088:     end,
 3089: 
 3090:     spawn_opt_max_heap_size_do(fun oom_fun/1),
 3091: 
 3092:     io:format("Repeat tests with refc binaries\n",[]),
 3093: 
 3094:     spawn_opt_max_heap_size_do(fun oom_bin_fun/1),
 3095: 
 3096:     error_logger:delete_report_handler(?MODULE),
 3097:     ok.
 3098: 
 3099: spawn_opt_max_heap_size_do(OomFun) ->
 3100:     Max = 2024,
 3101:     %% Test that numerical limit works
 3102:     max_heap_size_test(Max, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 3103: 
 3104:     %% Test that map limit works
 3105:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max }, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 3106: 
 3107:     %% Test that no kill is sent
 3108:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max, kill => false }, Max, false, true, OomFun),
 3109: 
 3110:     %% Test that no error_logger report is sent
 3111:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max, error_logger => false }, Max, true, false, OomFun),
 3112: 
 3113:     %% Test that system_flag works
 3114:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, OomFun(#{ size => 0, kill => false,
 3115:                                                 error_logger => true})),
 3116:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max }, Max, false, true, OomFun),
 3117:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max, kill => true }, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 3118: 
 3119:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, OomFun(#{ size => 0, kill => true,
 3120:                                                 error_logger => false})),
 3121:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max }, Max, true, false, OomFun),
 3122:     max_heap_size_test(#{ size => Max, error_logger => true }, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 3123: 
 3124:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, OomFun(#{ size => 1 bsl 16, kill => true,
 3125:                                                 error_logger => true})),
 3126:     max_heap_size_test(#{ }, 1 bsl 16, true, true, OomFun),
 3127: 
 3128:     erlang:system_flag(max_heap_size, #{ size => 0, kill => true,
 3129:                                          error_logger => true}),
 3130: 
 3131:     %% Test that ordinary case works as expected again
 3132:     max_heap_size_test(Max, Max, true, true, OomFun),
 3133:     ok.
 3134: 
 3135: 
 3136: mhs_spawn_opt(Option) when map_get(size, Option) > 0;
 3137:                            is_integer(Option) ->
 3138:     [{max_heap_size, Option}];
 3139: mhs_spawn_opt(_) ->
 3140:     [].
 3141: 
 3142: max_heap_size_test(Option, Size, Kill, ErrorLogger, OomFun) ->
 3143:     SpOpt = mhs_spawn_opt(OomFun(Option)),
 3144:     Pid = spawn_opt(fun()-> OomFun(run) end, SpOpt),
 3145:     {max_heap_size, MHSz} = erlang:process_info(Pid, max_heap_size),
 3146:     ct:log("Default: ~p~nOption: ~p~nProc: ~p~nSize = ~p~nSpOpt = ~p~n",
 3147:            [erlang:system_info(max_heap_size), Option, MHSz, Size, SpOpt]),
 3148: 
 3149:     #{ size := Size} = MHSz,
 3150: 
 3151:     Ref = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
 3152:     if Kill ->
 3153:             receive
 3154:                 {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, Reason} ->
 3155:                     killed = Reason
 3156:             end;
 3157:        true ->
 3158:             ok
 3159:     end,
 3160:     if ErrorLogger ->
 3161:             receive
 3162:                 %% There must be at least one error message.
 3163:                 {error, _, {emulator, _, [Pid|_]}} ->
 3164:                     ok
 3165:             end;
 3166:        true ->
 3167:             ok
 3168:     end,
 3169:     if not Kill ->
 3170:             exit(Pid, die),
 3171:             receive
 3172:                 {'DOWN', Ref, process, Pid, die} ->
 3173:                     ok
 3174:             end,
 3175:             %% If the process was not killed, the limit may have
 3176:             %% been reached more than once and there may be
 3177:             %% more {error, ...} messages left.
 3178:             receive_error_messages(Pid);
 3179:        true ->
 3180:             ok
 3181:     end,
 3182: 
 3183:     %% Make sure that there are no unexpected messages.
 3184:     receive_unexpected().
 3185: 
 3186: oom_fun(Max) when is_integer(Max) -> Max;
 3187: oom_fun(Map) when is_map(Map)-> Map;
 3188: oom_fun(run) ->
 3189:     io:format("oom_fun() started\n",[]),
 3190:     oom_run_fun([], 100).
 3191: 
 3192: oom_run_fun(Acc0, 0) ->
 3193:     done;
 3194: oom_run_fun(Acc0, N) ->
 3195:     %% This is tail-recursive since the compiler is smart enough to figure
 3196:     %% out that a body-recursive variant never returns, and loops forever
 3197:     %% without keeping the list alive.
 3198:     timer:sleep(5),
 3199:     oom_run_fun([lists:seq(1, 1000) | Acc0], N-1).
 3200: 
 3201: oom_bin_fun(Max) when is_integer(Max) -> oom_bin_fun(#{size => Max});
 3202: oom_bin_fun(Map) when is_map(Map) -> Map#{include_shared_binaries => true};
 3203: oom_bin_fun(run) ->
 3204:     oom_bin_run_fun([], 10).
 3205: 
 3206: oom_bin_run_fun(Acc0, 0) ->
 3207:     done;
 3208: oom_bin_run_fun(Acc0, N) ->
 3209:     timer:sleep(5),
 3210:     oom_bin_run_fun([build_refc_bin(160, <<>>) | Acc0], N-1).
 3211: 
 3212: build_refc_bin(0, Acc) ->
 3213:     Acc;
 3214: build_refc_bin(N, Acc) ->
 3215:     build_refc_bin(N-1, <<Acc/binary, 0:(1000*8)>>).
 3216: 
 3217: 
 3218: receive_error_messages(Pid) ->
 3219:     receive
 3220:         {error, _, {emulator, _, [Pid|_]}} ->
 3221:             receive_error_messages(Pid)
 3222:     after 1000 ->
 3223:             ok
 3224:     end.
 3225: 
 3226: receive_unexpected() ->
 3227:     receive
 3228:         {info_report, _, _} ->
 3229:             %% May be an alarm message from os_mon. Ignore.
 3230:             receive_unexpected();
 3231:         M ->
 3232:             ct:fail({unexpected_message, M})
 3233:     after 10 ->
 3234:             ok
 3235:     end.
 3236: 
 3237: flush() ->
 3238:     receive
 3239:         _M -> flush()
 3240:     after 0 ->
 3241:             ok
 3242:     end.
 3243: 
 3244: %% error_logger report handler proxy
 3245: init(Pid) ->
 3246:     {ok, Pid}.
 3247: 
 3248: handle_event(Event, Pid) ->
 3249:     Pid ! Event,
 3250:     {ok, Pid}.
 3251: 
 3252: huge_arglist_child(A0, A1, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6, A7, A8, A9,
 3253:                    A10, A11, A12, A13, A14, A15, A16, A17, A18, A19,

 3279:     exit([A0, A1, A2, A3, A4, A5, A6, A7, A8, A9,

 3306: spawn_huge_arglist(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3307:     %% Huge in two different ways; encoded size and
 3308:     %% length...
 3309:     ArgListHead = [make_ref(),
 3310:                    lists:duplicate(1000000, $a),
 3311:                    <<1:8388608>>,
 3312:                    processes(),
 3313:                    erlang:ports(),
 3314:                    {hej, hopp},
 3315:                    <<17:8388608>>,
 3316:                    lists:duplicate(3000000, $x),
 3317:                    #{ a => 1, b => 2, c => 3, d => 4, e => 5}],
 3318:     ArgList = ArgListHead ++ lists:seq(1, 255 - length(ArgListHead)),
 3319: 
 3320:     io:format("size(term_to_binary(ArgList)) = ~p~n",
 3321:               [size(term_to_binary(ArgList))]),
 3322: 
 3323:     io:format("Testing spawn with huge argument list on local node...~n", []),
 3324:     spawn_huge_arglist_test(true, node(), ArgList),
 3325:     io:format("Testing spawn with huge argument list on local node with Node...~n", []),
 3326:     spawn_huge_arglist_test(false, node(), ArgList),
 3327:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 3328:     _ = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, module_info, []),
 3329:     io:format("Testing spawn with huge argument list on remote node ~p...~n", [Node]),
 3330:     spawn_huge_arglist_test(false, Node, ArgList),
 3331:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 3332:     ok.
 3333: 
 3334: spawn_huge_arglist_test(Local, Node, ArgList) ->
 3335: 
 3336:     R1 = case Local of
 3337:              true ->
 3338:                  spawn_request(?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList, [monitor]);
 3339:              false ->
 3340:                  spawn_request(Node, ?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList, [monitor])
 3341:          end,
 3342:     receive
 3343:         {spawn_reply, R1, ok, Pid1} ->
 3344:             Pid1 ! go,
 3345:             receive
 3346:                 {'DOWN', R1, process, Pid1, Reason1} ->
 3347:                     ArgList = Reason1
 3348:             end
 3349:     end,
 3350: 
 3351:     {Pid2, R2} = case Local of
 3352:                      true ->
 3353:                          spawn_monitor(?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList);
 3354:                      false ->
 3355:                          spawn_monitor(Node, ?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList)
 3356:                  end,
 3357:     Node = node(Pid2),
 3358:     Pid2 ! go,
 3359:     receive
 3360:         {'DOWN', R2, process, Pid2, Reason2} ->
 3361:             ArgList = Reason2
 3362:     end,
 3363: 
 3364:     {Pid3, R3} = case Local of
 3365:                      true ->
 3366:                          spawn_opt(?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList, [monitor]);
 3367:                      false ->
 3368:                          spawn_opt(Node, ?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList, [monitor])
 3369:                  end,
 3370:     Node = node(Pid3),
 3371:     Pid3 ! go,
 3372:     receive
 3373:         {'DOWN', R3, process, Pid3, Reason3} ->
 3374:             ArgList = Reason3
 3375:     end,
 3376: 
 3377:     OldTA = process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 3378:     Pid4 = case Local of
 3379:                true ->
 3380:                    spawn_link(?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList);
 3381:                false ->
 3382:                    spawn_link(Node, ?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList)
 3383:            end,
 3384:     Node = node(Pid4),
 3385:     Pid4 ! go,
 3386:     receive
 3387:         {'EXIT', Pid4, Reason4} ->
 3388:             ArgList = Reason4
 3389:     end,
 3390: 
 3391:     true = process_flag(trap_exit, OldTA),
 3392: 
 3393:     Pid5 = case Local of
 3394:                true ->
 3395:                    spawn(?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList);
 3396:                false ->
 3397:                    spawn(Node, ?MODULE, huge_arglist_child, ArgList)
 3398:            end,
 3399:     Node = node(Pid5),
 3400:     R5 = erlang:monitor(process, Pid5),
 3401:     Pid5 ! go,
 3402:     receive
 3403:         {'DOWN', R5, process, Pid5, Reason5} ->
 3404:             ArgList = Reason5
 3405:     end,
 3406:     ok.
 3407: 
 3408: spawn_request_bif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3409:     io:format("Testing spawn_request() on local node...~n", []),
 3410:     spawn_request_bif_test(true, node()),
 3411:     io:format("Testing spawn_request() on local node with Node...~n", []),
 3412:     spawn_request_bif_test(false, node()),
 3413:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 3414:     io:format("Testing spawn_request() on remote node ~p...~n", [Node]),
 3415:     spawn_request_bif_test(false, Node),
 3416:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 3417:     ok.
 3418:                        
 3419: spawn_request_bif_test(Local, Node) ->
 3420: 
 3421:     Me = self(),
 3422: 
 3423:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 3424: 
 3425:     T1 = {test, 1},
 3426:     F1 = fun () -> exit({exit, T1}) end,
 3427:     R1 = if Local ->
 3428:                  spawn_request(F1, [{reply_tag, T1}, monitor, link]);
 3429:             true ->
 3430:                  spawn_request(Node, F1, [{reply_tag, T1}, monitor, link])
 3431:          end,
 3432:     receive
 3433:         {T1, R1, ok, P1} ->
 3434:             receive
 3435:                 {'DOWN', R1, process, P1, {exit, T1}} ->
 3436:                     ok
 3437:             end,
 3438:             receive
 3439:                 {'EXIT', P1, {exit, T1}} ->
 3440:                     ok
 3441:             end
 3442:     end,
 3443: 
 3444:     R1b = if Local ->
 3445:                  spawn_request(F1, [monitor, link]);
 3446:             true ->
 3447:                  spawn_request(Node, F1, [monitor, link])
 3448:          end,
 3449:     receive
 3450:         {spawn_reply, R1b, ok, P1b} ->
 3451:             receive
 3452:                 {'DOWN', R1b, process, P1b, {exit, T1}} ->
 3453:                     ok
 3454:             end,
 3455:             receive
 3456:                 {'EXIT', P1b, {exit, T1}} ->
 3457:                     ok
 3458:             end
 3459:     end,
 3460: 
 3461:     Ref1c = make_ref(),
 3462:     F1c = fun () -> Me ! Ref1c end,
 3463:     R1c = if Local ->
 3464:                   spawn_request(F1c);
 3465:              true ->
 3466:                   spawn_request(Node, F1c)
 3467:             end,
 3468:     receive
 3469:         {spawn_reply, R1c, ok, _P1c} ->
 3470:             receive Ref1c -> ok end
 3471:     end,
 3472: 
 3473:     R1e = if Local ->
 3474:                  spawn_request(F1, [monitors, links, {reply_tag, T1}]);
 3475:             true ->
 3476:                  spawn_request(Node, F1, [monitors, links, {reply_tag, T1}])
 3477:          end,
 3478:     receive
 3479:         {T1, R1e, error, BadOpt1} ->
 3480:             badopt = BadOpt1,
 3481:             ok
 3482:     end,
 3483:     ok = try
 3484:              BadF = fun (X) -> exit({X,T1}) end,
 3485:              if Local ->
 3486:                      spawn_request(BadF, [monitor, {reply_tag, T1}, link]);
 3487:                 true ->
 3488:                      spawn_request(Node, BadF, [monitor, {reply_tag, T1}, link])
 3489:              end,
 3490:              nok
 3491:          catch
 3492:              error:badarg -> ok
 3493:          end,
 3494:     ok = try
 3495:              spawn_request(<<"node">>, F1, [monitor, link], T1),
 3496:              nok
 3497:          catch
 3498:              error:badarg -> ok
 3499:          end,
 3500: 
 3501:     T2 = {test, 2},
 3502:     M2 = erlang,
 3503:     F2 = exit,
 3504:     Reason2 = {exit, T2},
 3505:     Args2 = [Reason2],
 3506:     R2 = if Local ->
 3507:                  spawn_request(M2, F2, Args2, [monitor, link, {reply_tag, T2}]);
 3508:             true ->
 3509:                  spawn_request(Node, M2, F2, Args2, [monitor, link, {reply_tag, T2}])
 3510:             end,
 3511:     receive
 3512:         {T2, R2, ok, P2} ->
 3513:             receive
 3514:                 {'DOWN', R2, process, P2, Reason2} ->
 3515:                     ok
 3516:             end,
 3517:             receive
 3518:                 {'EXIT', P2, Reason2} ->
 3519:                     ok
 3520:             end
 3521:     end,
 3522: 
 3523:     R2b = if Local ->
 3524:                  spawn_request(M2, F2, Args2, [monitor, link]);
 3525:             true ->
 3526:                  spawn_request(Node, M2, F2, Args2, [monitor, link])
 3527:             end,
 3528:     receive
 3529:         {spawn_reply, R2b, ok, P2b} ->
 3530:             receive
 3531:                 {'DOWN', R2b, process, P2b, Reason2} ->
 3532:                     ok
 3533:             end,
 3534:             receive
 3535:                 {'EXIT', P2b, Reason2} ->
 3536:                     ok
 3537:             end
 3538:     end,
 3539: 
 3540:     Ref2c = make_ref(),
 3541:     R2c = if Local ->
 3542:                   spawn_request(erlang, send, [Me, Ref2c]);
 3543:              true ->
 3544:                   spawn_request(Node, erlang, send, [Me, Ref2c])
 3545:             end,
 3546:     receive
 3547:         {spawn_reply, R2c, ok, _P2c} ->
 3548:             receive Ref2c -> ok end
 3549:     end,
 3550: 
 3551:     R2e = if Local ->
 3552:                  spawn_request(M2, F2, Args2, [monitors, {reply_tag, T2}, links]);
 3553:             true ->
 3554:                  spawn_request(Node, M2, F2, Args2, [monitors, {reply_tag, T2}, links])
 3555:          end,
 3556:     receive
 3557:         {T2, R2e, error, BadOpt2} ->
 3558:             badopt = BadOpt2,
 3559:             ok
 3560:     end,
 3561: 
 3562:     R2eb = if Local ->
 3563:                  spawn_request(M2, F2, Args2, [monitors, links]);
 3564:             true ->
 3565:                  spawn_request(Node, M2, F2, Args2, [monitors, links])
 3566:          end,
 3567:     receive
 3568:         {spawn_reply, R2eb, error, BadOpt2b} ->
 3569:             badopt = BadOpt2b,
 3570:             ok
 3571:     end,
 3572: 
 3573:     ok = try
 3574:              if Local ->
 3575:                      spawn_request(M2, F2, [Args2|oops], [monitor, link, {reply_tag, T2}]);
 3576:                 true ->
 3577:                      spawn_request(Node, M2, F2, [Args2|oops], [monitor, link, {reply_tag, T2}])
 3578:              end,
 3579:              nok
 3580:          catch
 3581:              error:badarg -> ok
 3582:          end,
 3583:     ok = try
 3584:              if Local ->
 3585:                      spawn_request(M2, F2, [Args2|oops], [monitor, {reply_tag, blupp}, link]);
 3586:                 true ->
 3587:                      spawn_request(Node, M2, F2, [Args2|oops], [monitor, {reply_tag, blupp}, link])
 3588:              end,
 3589:              nok
 3590:          catch
 3591:              error:badarg -> ok
 3592:          end,
 3593:     ok = try
 3594:              if Local ->
 3595:                      spawn_request(M2, F2, [Args2|oops]);
 3596:                 true ->
 3597:                      spawn_request(Node, M2, F2, [Args2|oops])
 3598:              end,
 3599:              nok
 3600:          catch
 3601:              error:badarg -> ok
 3602:          end,
 3603:     ok = try
 3604:              if Local ->
 3605:                      spawn_request(M2, <<"exit">>, Args2, [monitor, {reply_tag, T2}, link]);
 3606:                 true ->
 3607:                      spawn_request(Node, M2, <<"exit">>, Args2, [monitor, {reply_tag, T2}, link])
 3608:              end,
 3609:              nok
 3610:          catch
 3611:              error:badarg -> ok
 3612:          end,
 3613:     ok = try
 3614:              if Local ->
 3615:                      spawn_request(M2, <<"exit">>, Args2, [monitor, link]);
 3616:                 true ->
 3617:                      spawn_request(Node, M2, <<"exit">>, Args2, [monitor, link])
 3618:              end,
 3619:              nok
 3620:          catch
 3621:              error:badarg -> ok
 3622:          end,
 3623:     ok = try
 3624:              if Local ->
 3625:                      spawn_request(M2, <<"exit">>, Args2);
 3626:                 true ->
 3627:                      spawn_request(Node, M2, <<"exit">>, Args2)
 3628:              end,
 3629:              nok
 3630:          catch
 3631:              error:badarg -> ok
 3632:          end,
 3633:     ok = try
 3634:              if Local ->
 3635:                      spawn_request(<<"erlang">>, F2, Args2, [{reply_tag, T2}, monitor, link]);
 3636:                 true ->
 3637:                      spawn_request(Node, <<"erlang">>, F2, Args2, [{reply_tag, T2}, monitor, link])
 3638:              end,
 3639:              nok
 3640:          catch
 3641:              error:badarg -> ok
 3642:          end,
 3643:     ok = try
 3644:              if Local ->
 3645:                      spawn_request(<<"erlang">>, F2, Args2, [monitor, link]);
 3646:                 true ->
 3647:                      spawn_request(Node, <<"erlang">>, F2, Args2, [monitor, link])
 3648:              end,
 3649:              nok
 3650:          catch
 3651:              error:badarg -> ok
 3652:          end,
 3653:     ok = try
 3654:              if Local ->
 3655:                      spawn_request(<<"erlang">>, F2, Args2);
 3656:                 true ->
 3657:                      spawn_request(Node, <<"erlang">>, F2, Args2)
 3658:              end,
 3659:              nok
 3660:          catch
 3661:              error:badarg -> ok
 3662:          end,
 3663:     ok = try
 3664:              spawn_request(<<"node">>, M2, F2, Args2, [{reply_tag, T2}, monitor, link]),
 3665:              nok
 3666:          catch
 3667:              error:badarg -> ok
 3668:          end,
 3669:     ok = try
 3670:              spawn_request(<<"node">>, M2, F2, Args2, [monitor, link]),
 3671:              nok
 3672:          catch
 3673:              error:badarg -> ok
 3674:          end,
 3675:     ok = try
 3676:              spawn_request(<<"node">>, M2, F2, Args2),
 3677:              nok
 3678:          catch
 3679:              error:badarg -> ok
 3680:          end,
 3681:     ok.

 3683: 
 3684: spawn_request_monitor_demonitor(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3685:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 3686:     BlockFun = fun () ->
 3687:                        erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
 3688:                        erts_debug:set_internal_state(block, 1000),
 3689:                        ok
 3690:                end,
 3691: 
 3692:     %% Block receiver node...
 3693:     spawn_request(Node, BlockFun, [{priority,max}, link]),
 3694:     receive after 100 -> ok end,
 3695: 
 3696:     erlang:yield(),
 3697:     R = spawn_request(Node, timer, sleep, [10000], [monitor]),
 3698:     %% Should not be possible to demonitor
 3699:     %% before operation has succeeded...
 3700:     {monitors, []} = process_info(self(), monitors),
 3701:     false = erlang:demonitor(R, [info]), %% Should be ignored by VM...
 3702:     receive
 3703:         {spawn_reply, R, ok, P} ->
 3704:             {monitors, [{process,P}]} = process_info(self(), monitors),
 3705:             true = erlang:demonitor(R, [info]),
 3706:             {monitors, []} = process_info(self(), monitors),
 3707:             exit(P, kill)
 3708:     end,
 3709:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 3710:     ok.
 3711: 
 3712: spawn_request_monitor_child_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3713:     %% Early child exit...
 3714:     Tag = {a, tag},
 3715:     R1 = spawn_request(nonexisting_module, nonexisting_function, [], [monitor, {reply_tag, Tag}]),
 3716:     receive
 3717:         {Tag, R1, ok, P1} ->
 3718:             receive
 3719:                 {'DOWN', R1, process, P1, Reason1} ->
 3720:                     {undef, _} = Reason1
 3721:             end
 3722:     end,
 3723:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 3724:     R2 = spawn_request(Node, nonexisting_module, nonexisting_function, [], [{reply_tag, Tag}, monitor]),
 3725:     receive
 3726:         {Tag, R2, ok, P2} ->
 3727:             receive
 3728:                 {'DOWN', R2, process, P2, Reason2} ->
 3729:                     {undef, _} = Reason2
 3730:             end
 3731:     end,
 3732:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 3733:     ok.
 3734: 
 3735: spawn_request_link_child_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3736:     %% Early child exit...
 3737:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 3738:     Tag = {a, tag},
 3739:     R1 = spawn_request(nonexisting_module, nonexisting_function, [], [{reply_tag, Tag}, link]),
 3740:     receive
 3741:         {Tag, R1, ok, P1} ->
 3742:             receive
 3743:                 {'EXIT', P1, Reason1} ->
 3744:                     {undef, _} = Reason1
 3745:             end
 3746:     end,
 3747:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 3748:     R2 = spawn_request(Node, nonexisting_module, nonexisting_function, [], [link, {reply_tag, Tag}]),
 3749:     receive
 3750:         {Tag, R2, ok, P2} ->
 3751:             receive
 3752:                 {'EXIT', P2, Reason2} ->
 3753:                     {undef, _} = Reason2
 3754:             end
 3755:     end,
 3756:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 3757:     ok.
 3758: 
 3759: spawn_request_link_parent_exit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3760:     C1 = spawn_request_link_parent_exit_test(node(), false),
 3761:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 3762:     C2 = spawn_request_link_parent_exit_test(Node, false),
 3763:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 3764:     {comment, C1 ++ " " ++ C2}.
 3765: 
 3766: spawn_request_link_parent_exit_compound_reason(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3767:     C1 = spawn_request_link_parent_exit_test(node(), true),
 3768:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 3769:     C2 = spawn_request_link_parent_exit_test(Node, true),
 3770:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 3771:     {comment, C1 ++ " " ++ C2}.
 3772: 
 3773: spawn_request_link_parent_exit_test(Node, CompoundExitReason) ->
 3774:     %% Early parent exit...
 3775:     Tester = self(),
 3776: 
 3777:     ExitReason = if CompoundExitReason -> "kaboom";
 3778:                     true -> kaboom
 3779:                  end,
 3780: 
 3781:     verify_nc(node()),
 3782: 
 3783:     %% Ensure code loaded on other node...
 3784:     _ = rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, module_info, []),
 3785: 
 3786:     ParentFun = case node() == Node of
 3787:                     true ->
 3788:                         fun (Wait) ->
 3789:                                 spawn_request(?MODULE, spawn_request_test_exit_child,
 3790:                                               [Tester], [link,{priority,max}]),
 3791:                                 receive after Wait -> ok end,
 3792:                                 exit(ExitReason)
 3793:                         end;
 3794:                     false ->
 3795:                         fun (Wait) ->
 3796:                                 spawn_request(Node, ?MODULE,
 3797:                                               spawn_request_test_exit_child,
 3798:                                               [Tester], [link,{priority,max}]),
 3799:                                 receive after Wait -> ok end,
 3800:                                 exit(ExitReason)
 3801:                         end
 3802:                 end,
 3803:     lists:foreach(fun (N) ->
 3804:                           spawn_opt(fun () ->
 3805:                                             %% Give parent some work to do when
 3806:                                             %% exiting and by this increase
 3807:                                             %% possibilities for races...
 3808:                                             T = ets:new(x,[]),
 3809:                                             ets:insert(T, lists:map(fun (I) ->
 3810:                                                                             {I,I}
 3811:                                                                     end,
 3812:                                                                     lists:seq(1,10000))),
 3813:                                             ParentFun(N rem 10) end,
 3814:                                     [{priority, max}])
 3815:                   end,
 3816:                   lists:seq(1, 10000)),
 3817:     N = gather_parent_exits(ExitReason, false),
 3818:     CFs = erpc:call(Node,
 3819:                     fun () ->
 3820:                             %% Ensure all children have had time to enter an exiting state...
 3821:                             receive after 100*test_server:timetrap_scale_factor() -> ok end,
 3822:                             lists:map(fun (P) ->
 3823:                                               {P, process_info(P, current_function)}
 3824:                                       end, processes())
 3825:                     end),
 3826:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, {current_function, {?MODULE, spawn_request_test_exit_child, 1}}}) ->
 3827:                           ct:fail({missing_exit_to_child_detected, P});
 3828:                       (_) ->
 3829:                           ok
 3830:                   end, CFs),
 3831:     Comment =
 3832:         "Got "
 3833:         ++ integer_to_list(N)
 3834:         ++ if node() == Node -> " node local";
 3835:                   true -> " node remote"
 3836:            end
 3837:         ++ if CompoundExitReason -> " \"kaboom\"";
 3838:               true -> " \'kaboom\'"
 3839:            end
 3840:         ++ " exits!",
 3841:     erlang:display(Comment),
 3842:     Comment.
 3843: 
 3844: spawn_request_link_parent_exit_nodedown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3845:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(#{connection => 0}),
 3846:     N = 1000,
 3847:     ExitCounter = spawn(Node, fun exit_counter/0),
 3848:     lists:foreach(fun (_) ->
 3849:                           spawn_request_link_parent_exit_nodedown_test(Node)
 3850:                   end,
 3851:                   lists:seq(1, N)),
 3852:     ResRef = make_ref(),
 3853:     ExitCounter ! {get_results, self(), ResRef},
 3854:     Cmnt = receive
 3855:                {ResRef, CntMap} ->
 3856:                    lists:flatten(
 3857:                      ["In total ", integer_to_list(N), " exits. ",
 3858:                       "Detected exits: ",
 3859:                       maps:fold(fun (ExitReason, Count, "") ->
 3860:                                         io_lib:format("~p exit ~p times",
 3861:                                                       [ExitReason, Count]);
 3862:                                     (ExitReason, Count, Acc) ->
 3863:                                         [Acc, io_lib:format("; ~p exit ~p times",
 3864:                                                             [ExitReason, Count])]
 3865:                                 end,
 3866:                                 "",
 3867:                                 CntMap),
 3868:                       "."])
 3869:            end,
 3870:     io:format("~s~n", [Cmnt]),
 3871:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 3872:     {comment, Cmnt}.
 3873: 
 3874: exit_counter() ->
 3875:     true = register(exit_counter, self()),
 3876:     exit_counter(#{}).
 3877: 
 3878: exit_counter(CntMap) ->
 3879:     receive
